0.title: WI's Obed McCoy dedicates 'Man of the Match' award vs India to his mother
0.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy, who broke the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India in the second T20I on Monday, dedicated his 'Man of the Match' award to his mother. "She is sick and she has motivated me to be a better player," said McCoy at the post-match presentation. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 in the match.

1.title: Ex-K'taka minister's employee steals valuables from his B'luru home, arrested
1.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested an employee of former Karnataka Home Minister MB Patil for allegedly stealing foreign currency and valuables from his house in Bengaluru's Sadashivanagar. The accused, Jayanth Kumar, is a native of Odisha. Kumar used to work as a laundryman at Patil's home, police said, adding that he gifted the stolen watches to his friends in Odisha.

2.title: Goa CM urges citizens to join ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign
2.article_body: Ahead of the country's 75th Independence Day celebrations, Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant urged people to participate in the ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’ campaign and hoist the tricolour flag at their houses from August 13 to 16. “I urge Goans to keep the national flag as their display picture on social media from August 2 onwards,” Sawant said.

3.title: Polio was in NYC wastewater a month before case was detected: Official
3.article_body: New York health officials said that polio virus was present in wastewater of New York City suburb a month before health officials confirmed a case last month. In an emailed statement, US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said there may be more people shedding the virus in their stool. Officials urged residents to be sure they are vaccinated.

4.title: Went wicketless after Murali wished me luck: Nilesh on 1997 Test vs SL
4.article_body: Recalling a Test match against Sri Lanka in 1997, ex-India spinner Nilesh Kulkarni said he got a wicket off his first ball in the match, but couldn't take a wicket in the game after that. "I'd met Muttiah Muralitharan...[after the day's play], he said '...Good luck for...next three days'. Little did I realise...I wouldn't pick a wicket," added Nilesh.

5.title: Storms hit Kentucky's flooded areas, curfews imposed due to looting
5.article_body: Disaster-hit areas in eastern Kentucky witnessed another round of storms on Monday. Death toll due to floods rose to 37 on Tuesday. According to Governor, rescue operations continue at a time when hundreds of people remain unaccounted for. Authorities declared county-wide nighttime curfews amidst looting reports in Breathitt County and Hindman in Knott County, which are devastated due to floods.

6.title: Go First car goes under IndiGo plane, narrowly avoiding collision at Delhi airport
6.article_body: A car belonging to Go First airline went under an IndiGo aircraft at Delhi airport on Tuesday, narrowly avoiding collision with the plane's nose wheel. The aircraft was readying to depart for Dhaka when the incident took place. A video of the incident has also surfaced on social media. According to officials, the DGCA will investigate the incident.

7.title: Whenever you do 'Koffee...' someone cries: Aamir Khan to Karan Johar
7.article_body: During his appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7' which is hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar, actor Aamir Khan said, "Whenever you do your show, someone...cries." Aamir was accompanied by actress Kareena Kapoor. Responding to a question about the thing she tolerates about Aamir, Kareena stated him taking 100-200 days for shooting a film, which Akshay Kumar does in 30 days.

8.title: I really have to work on my phrasing: Brad Pitt on retirement claim
8.article_body: On being asked about his statement of being in the "last semester or trimester" of his career, actor Brad Pitt said that he really has to work on his phrasing. "I was just saying I'm past middle age and I want to be specific about how I spend those last things however they may be," the actor added.

9.title: Arshdeep has bowled tough overs for PBKS, that's why he was confident vs WI: Parthiv
9.article_body: Talking about pacer Arshdeep Singh, ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel said the 23-year-old was "confident" in his bowling in the second T20I against West Indies on Monday. "Arshdeep has been bowling those tough overs [for PBKS], that's the reason why you could see the confidence in him," added Parthiv. Arshdeep registered figures of 1/26 off his four overs in the game.

10.title: DDA's cash deficit due to unsold housing inventory of ₹18,000 cr: Govt
10.article_body: Delhi Development Authority's cash deficit of ₹9,615 crore is primarily due to unsold housing inventory worth around ₹18,000 crore, Housing and Urban Affairs Minister of State, Kaushal Kishore, informed the Rajya Sabha. The housing stock is lying unsold since 2014 as small flats located in the Narela area are deemed to be too costly and lack Metro connectivity, Kishore stated.

11.title: 10 villa owners booked for illegal rentals in Pune's Lonavala
11.article_body: Pune's Lonavala police have booked 10 villa owners between July 29 and July 31 for allegedly illegally renting their properties to tourists. The city's municipal council also urged owners to not rent villas without checking safety measures. "Our drive has intensified after...two recent deaths. Owners should either get requisite licence or stop renting villas and bungalows," an inspector said.

12.title: Terrorists hurl grenade at police post in J&K's Ramban
12.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a police post in the Gool area of Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district on Tuesday, said officials. The grenade exploded on the roof of the police post, however, no injuries were reported. Jammu Kashmir Ghaznavi Force (JKGF), an offshoot of Lashkar-e-Taiba, has claimed responsibility for the attack in a letter, said ADGP Mukesh Singh.

13.title: California declares state of emergency over monkeypox outbreak
13.article_body: California has declared a state of emergency due to the spread of monkeypox in a bid to escalate efforts to combat the outbreak. Emergency medical officials will be allowed to administer monkeypox vaccines approved by the federal government. Last week, the state expanded its testing capacity to carry out more than 1,000 tests a week.

14.title: Russian action at Ukraine's nuclear plant risks terrible accident: US
14.article_body: The US has accused Russia of using Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant as a 'nuclear shield' and risking a terrible nuclear accident. US said that Russia has stationed troops near Zaporizhzhia plant, Ukraine's biggest nuclear power plant, and preventing Ukrainian forces from returning fire. In March, Russia was accused of firing shells dangerously close to the nuclear power plant.

15.title: US might control export of its chipmaking equipment to China: Report
15.article_body: US might limit shipment of American chipmaking equipment to Chinese memory chip makers with an aim to stop China's semiconductor sector advances, reports said. US might ban the export of tools to China used to make NAND chips. If amended, this would be first US step to target China's production of memory chips without specialised military apps through export controls.

16.title: Arvind Kejriwal promises free education and jobs in Gujarat
16.article_body: AAP convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Monday criticised BJP over unemployment and hooch tragedies in Gujarat. "I appeal to the people to choose AAP if you want free quality education and employment for your youth. You may vote for the BJP if you wish to feed them spurious liquor," said Kejriwal. He also promised unemployment allowance if AAP wins the polls.

17.title: Reduce fossil fuel use, adopt green energy for public transport: Gadkari
17.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari stressed on the need to reduce fossil fuel consumption and adopt green energy for public transport and said the fare in electric buses can be 30% less than diesel ones. "Need to change country's transport system...Instead of petrol and diesel, we should focus on cheaper options like electricity, green hydrogen, ethanol and Bio-CNG," Gadkari added.

18.title: ED searches newspaper head office in Delhi in National Herald case
18.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday conducted searches at multiple places, including Herald House on Delhi's Bahadur Shah Zafar Marg, reports said. The searches were conducted in connection with ED's probe into the National Herald case under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). Searches were conducted days after Congress President Sonia Gandhi was questioned in case.

19.title: Law student stabs classmate over love triangle in Lucknow university
19.article_body: A law student stabbed his classmate multiple times with a machete over an alleged love triangle at a private university in Lucknow. The victim suffered injuries around his neck, head and hands and has undergone multiple surgeries. The victim and accused had a fight a few days ago over a girl in their class. The accused is in custody.

20.title: Delhi's 1st monkeypox patient discharged: LNJP Hospital MD
20.article_body: Delhi's first monkeypox patient has been successfully discharged, Suresh Kumar, the Medical Director (MD) of the national capital's LNJP Hospital, said on Tuesday. He added that the man, who had no history of foreign travel, recovered in 25 days as "all symptoms waned away". This comes a day after a second monkeypox case was reported in Delhi.

21.title: Productivity at Google is not where it needs to be, there are real concerns: CEO
21.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai at a recent all-hands meeting said, "There are real concerns that our productivity...is not where it needs to be for the headcount we have." Pichai asked employees to help "create a culture that is more mission-focused", CNBC reported. "We should think about how we can minimise distractions and really raise the bar on...productivity," he added.

22.title: Afghanistan needs India's help desperately: Taliban
22.article_body: Taliban militant Sirajuddin Haqqani said that Afghanistan "desperately" needs India's help, adding that India has a name in technology and trust in the international community that it fulfils its promises. "India has historical ties with Afghanistan. India had started some research and developmental programmes in Afghanistan...We want the unfinished projects...be...completed," he added.

23.title: We should be little kind to Hindi films: Alia on North vs South debate
23.article_body: Reacting to the North vs South debate, actress Alia Bhatt has said that it has been a tough year for Indian cinema. "We should be a little kind to Hindi films...Even in the South industry, all their films have not worked [this year]," she added. Alia further stated that a film with good content "always" does well.

24.title: Beyoncé to remove ableist lyric from new song 'Heated' amid backlash
24.article_body: Singer-songwriter Beyoncé has confirmed that she will change the lyrics of her new song 'Heated' which were called ableist and offensive by disability activists. The lyrics, co-written by Canadian singer Drake, have the line, "Spazzin' on that a**, spazz on that a**." "The word, not used intentionally in a harmful way, will be replaced," her statement read.

25.title: SC imposes ₹5 lakh fine on NGO over Noida's twin towers' petition
25.article_body: The Supreme Court asked an NGO to pay ₹5 lakh fine for filing a PIL seeking alteration of its year-old judgement directing demolition of Supertech twin towers in Noida Sector 93A. The petition urged court to utilise the 40-storey towers for some "national cause" instead of demolishing. The court asked the petitioner to deposit the amount within four weeks.

26.title: Water supply in parts of Pune to be shut off on Thursday
26.article_body: The water supply in parts of Pune will remain shut off on Thursday due to maintenance and repair work at the Parvati and Lashkar water stations. The water supply on Friday will be low pressure and delayed, Pune Municipal Corporation officials said. The areas which will get affected include Dattawadi, Rajendra Nagar, Mula Road, Koregaon Park, Wanawadi and others.

27.title: K'taka HC issues notices to Centre, state over detention of Sri Lankan citizens
27.article_body: Karnataka High Court has issued notices to the union and state governments over the alleged detention of Sri Lankan citizens in Bangalore Central Jail in Parappana Agrahara. A PIL has been filed on behalf of 25 persons claiming that the detention is illegal and a violation of human rights. It also seeks the transfer of the accused to detention centres.

28.title: Russia seeks to ban 'unfriendly' nations from adopting Russian children
28.article_body: Russian lawmakers on Monday tabled a bill in the lower house of the Parliament to ban the adoption of Russian children by citizens of "unfriendly" countries. If passed, the bill would expand a 2012 law that prohibits US citizens from adopting Russian children. Russia's list of unfriendly countries was expanded after several nations imposed sanctions on Moscow over Ukraine invasion.

29.title: Circulation of fake ₹2,000 notes decreased in banking system from 2018-19: Govt
29.article_body: The Union Ministry of Finance told Lok Sabha that circulation of fake ₹2,000 denomination currency notes has decreased in banking system from 2018-19. "In 2021-22, the number of fake currency notes of ₹2,000 denomination detected in banking system was 13,604 pieces which is 0.000635% of total number of banknotes of ₹2,000 denomination in circulation," MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said.

30.title: Another monkeypox case reported in Kerala, India's tally reaches 7
30.article_body: Kerala Health Minister Veena George on Tuesday informed that another monkeypox case was reported in the state, making it the fifth case in the state and seventh in India. The patient is a 30-year-old man who reached Kozhikode airport from UAE on July 27 and is currently undergoing treatment in Malappuram. Other two cases of monkeypox were reported in Delhi.

31.title: 2 women try to sell newborn girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai; arrested
31.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her associate were arrested for allegedly trying to sell a 15-day-old baby girl for ₹4.5 lakh in Mumbai. A member of Central Adoption Resources Authority received a tip-off about a woman who was looking for a buyer for the baby. He along with police tricked her into selling the babygirl to him and caught her red-handed.

32.title: Oil extends losses amid global demand concerns, manufacturing data
32.article_body: Oil prices on Tuesday extended the losses from the previous session with Brent crude futures falling 29 cents to $99.74 a barrel and WTI crude futures down 22 cents at $93.67 a barrel. The slide was driven by global oil demand concerns after weak manufacturing data in several countries. The Brent futures settled at $100.03 a barrel on Monday.

33.title: Murder accused ex-Army man, who acted in 28 films while hiding for 30 years, held
33.article_body: A murder accused, identified as Omprakash alias Pasha who earlier worked in the Indian Army's Signals Corps, has been arrested after 30 years. Pasha and his partner were booked in 1992 for allegedly stabbing to death a motorcyclist during a looting bid in Haryana. After the murder, Pasha started doing odd jobs, including acting in 28 regional and Bhojpuri films.

34.title: Maruti Suzuki India reports 8.2% increase in sales in July
34.article_body: Maruti Suzuki India on Monday reported an increase of 8.28% in total sales to 1,75,916 units in July 2022 against 1,62,462 units in the corresponding period last fiscal. Domestic passenger vehicle sales rose by 6.82% to 1,42,850 units, the carmaker said, adding that the shortage of electronic components had a slight impact on the production of vehicles.

35.title: 'Tiranga bike rally' for all MPs to be oraganised in Delhi tomorrow
35.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi said on Tuesday that the Culture Ministry is organising a 'Tiranga bike rally' for MPs of all political parties from Red Fort to the Parliament in Delhi tomorrow. He also urged all the MPs to join the rally at 8.30 am and stressed that the rally was organised by the ministry and not the BJP.

36.title: If you're not here to entertain me, go away: Kajol writes on Instagram
36.article_body: Actress Kajol recently took to Instagram Stories to share a seemingly angry and cryptic note. She wrote, "If you're not here to entertain me please go away and come back when you have some new material." This comes after Kajol marked 30 years in the film industry and shared a video montage of stills from her most notable projects.

37.title: Justin Bieber resumes world tour month after Ramsay Hunt Syndrome diagnosis
37.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber resumed his Justice world tour slightly over a month after his Ramsay Hunt Syndrome diagnosis. He shared pictures and videos from his performance in Italy at the Lucca Summer Festival on social media, writing, "Luv u guys and I missed you." Justin will be travelling to over 30 countries as part of his tour including India.

38.title: It took time to convince Harjinder to become a weightlifter: Coach
38.article_body: Talking about Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur who won a bronze medal at CWG 2022, her coach Paramjeet Sharma said, "It took some time to convince her to shift to weightlifting." "Sometimes Harjinder got carried away because of her own power," he added. Harjinder had earlier shared that the fodder she cut on a toka helped her build strong arms.

39.title: Not my money, was kept in my absence: Arpita on seized ₹50 crore
39.article_body: While reacting to the huge amount of cash seized from her flats, Arpita Mukherjee, ex-West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee's aide, on Tuesday said, "The money doesn't belong to me, it was kept there in my absence." Around ₹50 crore cash and jewellery were recovered from Mukherjee's two houses. Earlier, Chatterjee said the money doesn’t belong to him.

40.title: US used missile with 6 blades that slice through target to kill al-Qaeda chief: Reports
40.article_body: The US' Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) used the Hellfire R9X missile to eliminate al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, according to reports. Hellfire R9X is said to be a warhead-less missile equipped with six razor-like blades extending from the fuselage that slices through its target but does not explode. The missile has never been publicly acknowledged by the Pentagon or CIA.

41.title: Our weightlifting contingent has performed exceptionally well at CWG 2022: PM Modi
41.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has congratulated weightlifter Harjinder Kaur for winning the bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category at the CWG 2022. "Our weightlifting contingent has performed exceptionally well [in] Birmingham...Continuing this, Harjinder [has won] a bronze," wrote PM Modi. Notably, out of India's nine medals at CWG 2022 so far, seven have come from weightlifting.

42.title: Kohli will remain in his original no. 3 place: Jaffer on T20 WC
42.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said Virat Kohli should remain at his "original" number three spot in India's playing XI at the 2022 T20 World Cup. He added, "Rahul and Rohit should open...the aggressive approach that India has undertaken is very nice to witness. India's chances of winning (the WC) are bright." Kohli has been rested for the WI tour.

43.title: Ex-Sri Lankan Prez Gotabaya not getting any privileges: Singapore
43.article_body: Singapore Foreign Affairs Minister Vivian Balakrishnan said that former Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was not being accorded any privileges or immunity in Singapore. Rajapaksa fled Sri Lanka along with his wife on July 13 amid mass protests over his alleged mismanagement of the country's economy. He resigned as President after arriving in Singapore from the Maldives on July 14.

44.title: He needs no advice, he's magic & magician put together: Alia on SRK's flops
44.article_body: When asked what advice would she give to actor Shah Rukh Khan after few of his films flopped at the box office, actress Alia Bhatt said that he needs no advice. "He's the magic and magician put together. So I won't give any advice to him, rather I'll take advice from him on how magical he is," she added.

45.title: Reviving theatres not in our hand, viewers also responsible: Sudeep
45.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep, while reacting to shutting down of single-screen theatres in Karnataka, said reviving them is not in the industry's hand. "Reviving cannot happen with only one-hand clapping. One hand being...film industry...and...one big hand which can clap together, are...viewers," Sudeep said. He added people don't go to theatres thinking films will release on OTT platforms after some time.

46.title: Meeting Big B for 1st time was like meeting God, I was dumbstruck: KBC director
46.article_body: 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' director Arun Sheshkumar said that meeting actor Amitabh Bachchan for the first time was like meeting his God. "On October 11 every year, I would go and stand in front of his bungalow. The first time I met him, I was dumbstruck. He must have found me to be a low-confident guy," he added.

47.title: Don’t be brutal, time keeps changing for all: Uddhav Thackeray to BJP
47.article_body: Reacting to JP Nadda's statement that BJP would annihilate all regional parties and Shiv Sena was about to get finished in Maharashtra, Uddhav Thackeray said BJP shouldn't be so drunk on power. "Time keeps changing for everyone. You get back everything bad you do to others," he said. "BJP plot means dividing Hindus, crushing nativist and regional pride," he added.

48.title: Over 1,500 cattle die in Gujarat as lumpy skin disease affects multiple districts
48.article_body: The cattle death toll due to lumpy skin disease in Gujarat has reached 1,565, the state government said on Monday. The disease has spread in 2,083 villages across 20 districts and about 55,950 animals have been infected by the disease that spreads in cattle through blood-feeding insects. Mundra and Mandvi taluka are worst hit areas, a Gujarat Congress leader said.

49.title: IMD issues red alert for 10 districts in Kerala for today amid heavy rains
49.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) issued a 'red' alert for 10 districts in Kerala for today amid heavy rains in the state. The 'red' alert has been issued in all districts except Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta and Kasargod, where an 'orange' alert has been sounded for Tuesday and Wednesday. CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said six people have died amid heavy rains.

50.title: Was told 'You're too good looking,' star kids taken over looks: Karan Tacker
50.article_body: Television actor Karan Tacker has stated that he has faced rejection in the industry over superficial things like being "too good looking" and was told, "Don't be so fit". He called it hypocritical, saying that star kids are launched over their physicality. "Even with the best bodies, they will be playing roles that do not require bodies," the actor added.

51.title: Gogi gang sharpshooter arrested after encounter with police in Delhi
51.article_body: Delhi Police's Special Cell arrested an alleged sharpshooter belonging to Gogi gang following an encounter near Bhalswa Dairy in Delhi, police said on Monday. The accused, Bhagwan Singh, also used to work for Lawrence Bishnoi who is accused in the murder of Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, police added. Singh was injured in his left leg during the encounter.

52.title: 80 men arrested for gangraping 8 models shooting a music video in South Africa
52.article_body: More than 80 men suspected of gangraping eight models and armed robbery of a video production crew in the South African town of Krugersdorp were produced in court on Monday. "The crew of 12 women and 10 men were busy filming a music video when they were allegedly attacked by a group of armed men clad in blankets," police said.

53.title: Jaimangal was regularly meeting Assam CM, allegations false: BJP's Hazarika
53.article_body: Assam Minister Pijush Hazarika said that Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal is making fake allegations that three arrested MLAs had lured him to meet Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma. Sharing pictures of Jaimangal with the Assam CM and Union Minister Pralhad Joshi, Hazarika said that Jaimangal has been constantly meeting Assam CM and met him five days before filing "fabricated FIR".

54.title: My films come after 4 yrs, trade changes in that time; I'm concerned: Aamir
54.article_body: Actor Aamir khan said that he is concerned because his movies release after four years. "Trade always changes in these four years. Don't know what will happen when my next film releases," he said, adding that films come on OTT platforms very fast. "I have always tried to keep a six months gap, at least for my films," he added.

55.title: Arsenic found in groundwater in 209 districts, uranium in 152: Govt
55.article_body: Arsenic has been found in the groundwater in parts of 209 districts in 25 states and Union Territories, Minister of State for Jal Shakti, Bishweswar Tudu, informed the Rajya Sabha on Monday. Uranium has been found in parts of 152 districts in 18 states, he added. Lead has been found in parts of 176 districts in 21 states, Tudu stated.

56.title: Indian cyclist Ronaldo finishes 12th in men's 1000m time trial final at CWG 2022
56.article_body: Indian cyclist Ronaldo Laitonjam finished 12th in the men's 1000m time trial final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Monday. Ronaldo, who clocked 1:02.500 in the event, was 2.995 seconds behind gold medallist Matthew Glaetzer, who clocked 59.505. Ronaldo had earlier lost to Glaetzer in the pre-quarterfinals of the men's sprint event.

57.title: BJP seems unaffected by inflation, they’re thick-skinned people: Kharge
57.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday said that when people across India are affected by inflation, BJP seems to be unaffected by it. "They are thick-skinned people," Kharge added. "We are ready to discuss the issue of price rise and have a consensus among us to keep the issue of inflation in the House," he stated.

58.title: MP Mahua keeps her ₹1.5 lakh Louis Vuitton bag down amid inflation debate in Lok Sabha
58.article_body: A video being widely circulated on social media showed TMC MP Mahua Moitra keeping her bag down, moving it from beside her to near her feet, once TMC member Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar raised the issue of inflation in Lok Sabha on Monday. As per reports, it was a Louis Vuitton bag priced at more than ₹1.5 lakh.

59.title: Rahul known for shallow politics, doesn't have serious knowledge of topics: Patra
59.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Monday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is known for "shallow politics". "You are never serious about politics. You don't have serious knowledge of topics," Patra added. His statement came after Rahul Gandhi criticised the government over the recovery of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port. Unlike in past, drug smuggling doesn't go undetected now, Patra stated.

60.title: Dia Mirza pens note for 25-year-old niece who died in car accident in Hyderabad
60.article_body: Dia Mirza has penned a note for her niece, Tanya Kakde, who died at the age of 25 in a car accident near Hyderabad on Monday. Dia wrote, "My niece. My child. My jaan. Gone into the light. May you find peace and love wherever you are my darling." She added, "You always brought a smile to our hearts...Om Shanti."

61.title: 3-month-old boy dies after vaccination in Odisha; case filed
61.article_body: A case has been filed after a three-month-old boy died last week after he was allegedly administered a faulty vaccine in Odisha's Jajpur, according to police. As per the complaint, the boy started crying uncontrollably and developed high fever after getting the vaccine and a pulse polio drop. The baby's body was exhumed and sent for autopsy, an inspector said.

62.title: Nothing to hide: Zomato CEO on Blinkit Founder's relationship with its executive
62.article_body: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said there was "nothing to hide" about the relationship between its Chief People Officer Akriti Chopra and Blinkit Founder Albinder Dhindsa. The board was aware of it and Akriti was never involved in discussions relating to the ₹4,447-crore acquisition of Blinkit, Goyal explained. Earlier, Zomato was criticised for not disclosing that the two executives are married.

63.title: Zomato shares jump nearly 18% after June quarter earnings
63.article_body: Zomato's share price surged around 18% in Tuesday’s early trade after the company came out with its June quarter earnings on Monday. The stock gained 18.44% to hit ₹54.90 apiece against its previous close of ₹46.35 on BSE. Zomato reported a net loss of ₹186 crore for the June quarter against a net loss of ₹356 crore a year ago.

64.title: Rapper Drake tests +ve for COVID, postpones Young Money Reunion show
64.article_body: Taking to Instagram Stories, rapper Drake has revealed that he has tested positive for COVID-19. He further wrote, "The Young Money Reunion show is being rescheduled to the SOONEST date possible." "I'm...sorry for letting you down on our weekend together and the moment I test negative, I will give you everything I got on stage (except COVID-19)," he added.

65.title: Family carries woman's body on cot for post-mortem in MP
65.article_body: A tribal woman's body was carried on a cot by her family to take it for post-mortem reportedly due to the absence of a hearse vehicle from the government in the Kehraha Tola area in Madhya Pradesh's Singrauli. A police station in-charge said that the incident occurred as the area where the woman died is inaccessible to vehicles.

66.title: 3 youths molest woman for not giving way to their car in Pune; arrested
66.article_body: Three college students were arrested for allegedly molesting a woman during a road rage incident in Pune's Bavdhan on Sunday. The youths reportedly got angry as the woman didn't give way to their car despite them honking loudly, following which an argument broke out between them. They reportedly intercepted her vehicle and thrashed and molested the woman during the scuffle.

67.title: BMC to set up 3 new parking lots to decongest South Mumbai
67.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to set up parking facilities in three locations in South Mumbai to decongest these areas, a civic official said. The civic body has floated a tender for construction and maintenance of underground electro-mechanical car parking in the Fort area and two other robotic parking towers at Zaveri Bazaar and Matunga.

68.title: India likely to receive normal monsoon rains in August, September: IMD
68.article_body: The second half of southwest monsoon, from August to September is most likely to be normal for the country as a whole, IMD said on Monday. "Some deficiency may remain in Bihar, some northeastern states and other parts of the Indo-Gangetic plains," M Mohapatra, DG, IMD, said. "Above normal or excess rains are not expected for the region," Mohapatra added.

69.title: People say 'Are you PMSing?' To hell with you: Alia on sexism
69.article_body: Speaking about sexism, actress Alia Bhatt has stated that people say things like, 'Don't be so sensitive' and 'Are you PMSing?' "To hell with you, I am not being sensitive...You were born because women were PMSing," the actress added. She further stated that there is a certain understanding of how you should hide a lot of things as a woman.

70.title: Only similarity between 'Laal...' and 'PK' is innocence: Aamir Khan
70.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has stated that the only similarity between his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and 2014 film 'PK' is the innocence of the lead characters. "The difference...you will see in the whole performance," the actor added. Earlier, social media users had pointed out similarities between the two films after watching the trailer of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

71.title: We'll only make 'Gorkha' when we're 100% right with the subject: Aanand
71.article_body: Speaking about 'Gorkha', filmmaker Aanand L Rai has said, "We'll only make the film when we feel that we are 100% right with the subject and we've cracked it well." The film was announced in October last year and will feature actor Akshay Kumar. "We're finding the right bound script and the process is on as we speak," he stated.

72.title: Pune girl slips, fractures leg at Kataldhar Waterfall; rescued
72.article_body: A female trekker from Pune was rescued after she slipped on a rock and fractured her leg at Kataldhar Waterfall in Lonavala. Another trekker had contacted the Shivdurg rescue team when the girl got injured. The rescue team reached the spot within one and a half hours and gave the girl first aid. The incident took place on Sunday.

73.title: A step towards a safer world: Trudeau on al-Qaeda chief's killing
73.article_body:
Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said the death of al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri is a 
"step towards a safer world". "Canada will keep working with our global partners to counter terrorist threats, promote peace and security, and keep people here at home and around the world safe," Trudeau added. The al-Qaeda chief was killed in a US drone strike in Afghanistan.

74.title: Don't think we have many films like 'Raksha...' in B'wood: Akshay Kumar
74.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming film 'Raksha Bandhan', actor Akshay Kumar has said that he has played many different roles in his career, however, he has never played a role that focuses on the sister-brother bond. "Actually, I don't think we have many such films in our industry. So in that sense, I got to try something new," he further added.

75.title: If you don't give opportunity, they'll never know: Rohit on Avesh bowling final over
75.article_body: Talking about Avesh Khan bowling the final over in the second T20I when WI needed 10 runs to win and Bhuvneshwar Kumar had two overs left, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "It's all about giving opportunity." He added, "If you don't give opportunity to Avesh or Arshdeep, [they'll] never know what it is to bowl at death for India."

76.title: ITC Q1 net profit up 34% to ₹4,389.8 crore, revenue rises 39.2%
76.article_body: ITC Limited on Monday reported a 33.9% surge in consolidated net profit to ₹4,389.76 crore for the quarter ended June. Its revenue from operations during the said quarter rose 39.25% to ₹19,831.31 crore as against ₹14,240.76 crore a year ago. "Economic activity during the quarter gathered further momentum with an uptick in business and consumer sentiments," the Kolkata-headquartered company said.

77.title: I was made to feel worthless when I work my a** off: Janhvi on nepotism
77.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that she was made to feel worthless because she got opportunities in the film industry due to her parents Boney Kapoor and Sridevi. "I work my a** off to give it back to them for what they have done for me," the actress added. She further said that she feels overwhelming respect for her parents.

78.title: Heard explosion, people couldn't find way out: Hospital guard on MP fire
78.article_body: While talking about a fire that broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday, Ramkumar Patel, a security guard outside the New Life Multi-speciality Hospital near Damoh Naka, said that the fire started small but there was a "loud explosion". "Many people could not find a way out and died," Patel added.

79.title: Cricket betting racket busted in Hyderabad, over ₹5 lakh cash seized
79.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Monday busted a cricket betting racket and seized ₹5,91,820 in cash. Acting on a tip-off, a police team led by Inspector S Raghavendra raided a flat in Sulthan Bazar and arrested two accused persons who organised the racket and collected money from punters. According to police, one more suspect in the case is still absconding.

80.title: Assam to provide digital caste certificates to students
80.article_body: Assam government has launched ‘Mission Bhumiputra’, which aims to issue digital caste certificates to students across the state. The certificates will be available in the DigiLocker under the IT Act. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma inaugurated the Bhumiputra portal at a programme and lauded the mission. “Manual system of issuing caste certificates will be discontinued in Assam,” said Sarma.

81.title: Pune civic body to supply water via tankers for areas facing shortage
81.article_body: As the Baner, Balewadi, Pashan, Sus and Mahalunge areas in Pune are facing water supply problems, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to supply water in these areas using tankers until the supply problem is solved. "There has been sufficient storage in the dams...but improper planning of water distribution...has created water woes," former BJP corporator Amol Balwadkar said.

82.title: 1 man killed, 5 more wounded in shooting at apartment complex in US
82.article_body: One man was killed and five others were wounded in a shooting at an apartment complex in Northeast Washington on Monday night, the Metropolitan Police Department said. All the victims were adult males and those wounded were being treated at area hospitals. The circumstances of the shooting, including if the victims knew each other, were being investigated, police said.

83.title: France-based app developers sue Apple over app store fees
83.article_body: French app developers sued Apple on Monday accusing the latter of violating US antitrust law by overcharging them to use its app store. The complaint filed in a US court said that the iPhone maker abused its market monopoly over app distribution on iOS-based mobile devices by authorising only one app store. Apple is yet to comment on this.

84.title: Completely normal: Elon Musk's father on having 2 kids with his stepdaughter
84.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk's father Errol in an interview said that it was "completely normal" for him to have two children with his 35-year-old stepdaughter, Jana Bezuidenhout. He also reiterated, "The only thing we are on Earth for is to reproduce." Errol has a five-year-old son with Jana and had welcomed a daughter in 2019.

85.title: PM Modi changes display pic on social media to Tricolour, asks Indians to do the same
85.article_body: Ahead of the Independence Day, PM Narendra Modi changed the display picture on his social media accounts to Tricolour and urged all the Indians to do the same. "It's a special 2nd August today! At a time when we're marking Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav, our nation is all set for #HarGharTiranga, a collective movement to celebrate our Tricolour," he said.

86.title: BJP’s nefarious intentions to topple my govt have failed: J'khand CM
86.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren said that BJP’s "nefarious intentions" to topple his government have failed. "We saw another example of BJP’s hunger for power...This is a big attack on our country’s democracy. Nor was I unsettled by their acts earlier, neither I am today," Soren added. Earlier, three Jharkhand MLAs were caught with huge amount of cash in West Bengal.

87.title: MSRTC to introduce around 100 AC electric buses on Mumbai-Pune route
87.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has decided to introduce around 100 new air-conditioned electric buses on Mumbai-Pune route by end of this year, an official of MSRTC said. These e-buses will have a seating capacity of 45 passengers and facilities like mobile charging sockets, emergency buttons, etc. The cost of one electric bus is approximately ₹1.6 crore.

88.title: T'gana woman throws daughter in water sump, pretends robbers killed her
88.article_body: A woman in Telangana's Jangaon reportedly threw her one-year-old daughter in a water sump and pretended that a chain-snatcher killed her. She was picked up by the police on suspicion of killing the child hours after she claimed that a man threw the baby in the sump after she resisted a robbery attempt. She later reportedly confessed to her crime.

89.title: Raj HC judgment on parole for having baby cannot be precedent: SC
89.article_body: The Supreme Court has stated that Rajasthan High Court granting parole to a convict for fathering a child cannot be cited as a precedent. The apex court was hearing the Rajasthan government's plea challenging HC's order and refused to intervene. However, it maintained that state governments and jail authorities can raise objections if any other convict seeks the same liberty.

90.title: 26-year-old crashes into car’s open door in Punjab, dies after truck hits him
90.article_body: A 26-year-old man died after being run over by a truck after his bike crashed into a car's open door in Punjab's Landran on Sunday evening. The deceased, Manjit Singh, and his injured co-worker Vikram Singh were on their way home after finishing their shift at an automobile service station in Landran when the incident took place.

91.title: Man lynched over suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar's Samastipur
91.article_body: A Begusarai resident, Mushtakeen, was reportedly lynched by a mob over suspicion of cattle theft in Bihar's Samastipur on the intervening night of Sunday-Monday. According to locals, three people were trying to steal oxen. They said that while two of them managed to escape, one was caught and killed by the mob, a video of which surfaced on social media.

92.title: Harshal Patel ruled out of 3rd T20I vs WI due to a rib injury
92.article_body: Team India pacer Harshal Patel has been ruled out of the third T20I against West Indies due to a rib injury. Harshal was also not available for selection in the second T20I, which India lost by five wickets. Leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi was dropped to include Avesh Khan in the second T20I. The third T20I will be played today.

93.title: Raj reports 1st suspected monkeypox case, patient admitted to Jaipur hospital
93.article_body: Rajasthan has reported its first suspected case of monkeypox after a 20-year-old, showing symptoms of the virus, was admitted to a government hospital in Jaipur. His samples have been sent to Pune's National Institute of Virology, an official said. The suspected monkeypox patient has been suffering from fever for four days and has rashes on his body, the official added.

94.title: Chhattisgarh's Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri and Sonakhan to be renamed
94.article_body: Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel has instructed renaming of three places of historical significance in the state. The names of Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri and Sonakhan will be changed. Chandkhuri will be known as Mata Kaushalya Dham Chandkhuri, Giraudpuri will be renamed as Baba Guru Ghasidas Dham Giraudpuri and Sonakhan will be called Shaheed Veer Narayan Singh Dham Sonakhan.

95.title: Ram Gopal Yadav meets Yogi, SP says discussed minority issues
95.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader and Rajya Sabha MP Ram Gopal Yadav met UP CM Yogi Adityanath at his residence in Lucknow on Monday. The meeting reportedly lasted for about half-an-hour. In a tweet after the meeting, SP said, "Talks were held in the context of persecution of backwards and Muslims across the state by filing false cases unilaterally."

96.title: Man with loaded AK-47 arrested outside Iranian journalist's US home
96.article_body: A man with a loaded AK-47 rifle was arrested outside the New York City home of an Iranian-American journalist who has been critical of Iran's regime. Masih Alinejad, who was the target of an alleged Tehran-backed kidnapping plot last year, said the Iranian government sent the man and is targeting her for giving voice to those being oppressed in Iran.

97.title: FBI releases 'deceased' poster of al-Qaeda chief who had $25 mn bounty on his head
97.article_body: The FBI has added 'deceased' caption under the profile picture of Ayman al-Zawahiri on its website and released an updated poster, after the Al-Qaeda chief was killed by the US in a drone strike in Kabul. The poster states that under the Rewards For Justice Program, al-Zawahiri had $25 million bounty on his head.

98.title: We'll start shooting 'Pushpa 2' after strike in Telugu industry ends: Producer
98.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' producer Y Ravi Shankar opened up about the shoot of the 2021 film's sequel. "We have a strike going on here in the Telugu industry. Once the strike is over, we'll start from August-end or whenever the strike is over," he said. Shankar further added that they are ready to shoot the Allu Arjun-starrer.

99.title: Indiscipline can't be excused: Rasquinha on India's 4-4 draw vs Eng at CWG
99.article_body: Discussing the 4-4 draw between the Indian men's hockey team and England at CWG 2022, ex-Indian men's hockey team captain Viren Rasquinha tweeted there were "harsh" umpiring decisions against the former. Rasquinha however added the indiscipline which led to three cards for the Indian team was "inexcusable". "Letting a 4-1 lead...slip in the final quarter...[was] poor [by India]," he stated.

100.title: One of my bigger problems was adjusting to India: 'Decoupled' actress Sonia
100.article_body: Actress Sonia Rathee, who starred in 'Decoupled' and 'Broken But Beautiful 3', said one of her bigger problems was adjusting to India. "I spent my entire life in California and then...New York. So just coming here...understanding the way people worked, how Mumbai worked especially...was kind of my biggest challenge," she said, adding, "Now it has kind of become my home."

101.title: Oppn looking for 'mehengai' but it's not there: BJP's Jayant Sinha
101.article_body: BJP leader Jayant Sinha on Monday said there is no "mehengai" (inflation) and the Opposition has been looking for it but is unable to find it. "Look at it from the point of view of a common person, we have filled the 'thali' of the common person," Sinha added. "People are not feeling inflation because of PM's foresightedness," he stated.

102.title: 9 children die due to diarrhoea outbreak in Arunachal's Tirap
102.article_body: At least nine children, aged between three and 10, have died due to a diarrhoea outbreak in Arunachal Pradesh's Tirap in the last two weeks, officials said. The District Medical Officer said that the reason for the diarrhoea outbreak is yet to be ascertained. A medical team and an ambulance have been kept on standby at a community hall.

103.title: Couple solves 1.5L+ genetic hair fall cases with 93% success: Traya
103.article_body: Traya revealed that it has found a breakthrough in managing genetic hair fall. By combining tenets of Ayurveda, dermatology, and nutrition, the brand customizes a regime that aims to target factors like stress, sleep, poor nutrition, digestion which speed up balding. Users can take an online test to help them identify the cause of hair fall and treat it accordingly.

104.title: BJP is like fish out of water when not in power: Jharkhand CM
104.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren accused BJP of trying to destabilise his government, saying that BJP is like "fish out of water" when not in power. Examples of non BJP-ruled states are in front of you, he added. His statement comes after three Jharkhand Congress MLAs were arrested in West Bengal after unaccounted cash worth lakhs was recovered from them.

105.title: Sensex falls 171.8 points, Nifty down to 17,271 in opening trade
105.article_body: The benchmark indices opened marginally lower on Tuesday with the Sensex falling 171.83 points at 57,943.67, while the Nifty was down 68.50 points at 17,271.50. ITC, HUL, BPCL, Asian Paints were among the top Nifty gainers. Stocks of UPL, Eicher Motors, Hindalco Industries and Tata Steel slipped. The Nifty metal index lost 1% in opening trade.

106.title: 1 dead, 5 policemen injured as MP minister's pilot vehicle collides with car
106.article_body: A 60-year-old man died and seven others, including five policemen, were injured when the pilot vehicle accompanying Madhya Pradesh minister Yashodhara Raje Scindia collided with a car in Shivpuri on Monday. The deceased was sitting under a tree when the accident took place. The incident occurred near the Kali Pahadi area, about 65 kilometres from the district headquarters.

107.title: India reports 13,734 new COVID-19 cases, 16.5% less than yesterday
107.article_body: India has reported 13,734 COVID-19 cases, 17,897 recoveries and 34 deaths in the last 24 hours including seven reconciled deaths in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,464 cases and 39 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,39,792, while the death toll reached 5,26,430.

108.title: 3rd West Indies-India T20I to start at 9.30 pm tonight instead of 8 pm
108.article_body: The third West Indies-India T20I in St Kitts will begin at 9.30 pm (IST) tonight instead of 8 pm, Cricket West Indies announced. "Following the delayed start on Monday...the teams have agreed to start the third T20I at a later time to ensure the players receive adequate rest and recovery time for the back-to-back matches in St Kitts," it stated.

109.title: Zomato defends ₹4,447 cr acquisition of Blinkit, CEO says 'no skeletons in closet'
109.article_body: Zomato has defended its ₹4,447-crore acquisition of Blinkit, formerly Grofers. Addressing the criticism around the deal, Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said, "We have zero skeletons in the closet." The deal was reached after an objective evaluation and Zomato "negotiated hard on valuation", he added. Goyal also said his relationship with Blinkit Founder Albinder Dhindsa was "actually a good thing".

110.title: It would be 'odd' if I star opposite SRK, Salman or Aamir: Janhvi
110.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said it would be a little "odd" if she stars opposite actors Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan or Aamir Khan, adding that she would love to work with them. Discussing her journey in Bollywood, Janhvi stated, "I have been made to feel that I...got things I don't deserve which means that I am technically worthless."

111.title: We want guys to be flexible: Rohit on different openers in T20Is
111.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma, on being asked about the frequent changes in batting positions of players, said that the team wants batters to be flexible. "We want the guys to be able to bat anywhere and don't want them to be batting in specific positions," he explained. In the two WI T20Is, Suryakumar Yadav has opened alongside Rohit.

112.title: He is well built but he's eating badly: Elon's father on his shirtless pics
112.article_body: Reacting to Elon Musk's shirtless photos from Mykonos, his father Errol remarked that while the former is well built, "he’s been eating badly". In an interview, Errol said he had tried to recommend weight-loss supplements to Elon. He added that he still thought of Elon as a "little boy", even though he was over 50 now and "an old man".

113.title: Delhi bars, restaurants refuse to serve liquor over excise license expiry
113.article_body: Delhi bars and restaurants refused to serve alcohol after their excise licenses expired on July 31 over the state's rollback of its November 2021 excise policy. A restauranteur stated they incurred a ₹1-1.25 lakh loss and lost visitors to Gurugram and Noida. Delhi Lt Governor approved the state government's one-month extension of excise licenses of private liquor vendors on Monday.

114.title: What's the logic: Aamir on criticism over Mona Singh playing his mother in 'Laal Singh...'
114.article_body: Aamir Khan reacted to criticism over 40-year-old Mona Singh playing the role of his mother in their upcoming film Laal Singh Chaddha. "What is the logic...It is the beauty of the actor to look any age on the screen despite their real age," Aamir said. "You are snatching away her good work. This is wrong," he added.

115.title: Cyclist Meenakshi gets run over by rival after high-speed crash at CWG, video surfaces
115.article_body: Indian cyclist Meenakshi was run over by New Zealand's Bryony Botha after a high-speed crash during the women's 10-km scratch race at CWG 2022. Meenakshi fell from her bike before sliding down the banking on the bend after which Botha ran over her. Meenakshi was stretchered off, while Botha also fell from her bike.

116.title: Yasin Malik ends hunger strike in Tihar Jail after 10 days
116.article_body: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik, who was on hunger strike in Tihar Jail, discontinued his fasting after he was told that his demands have been forwarded to the authorities concerned. Malik went on an indefinite hunger strike after the Centre did not respond to his request to allow him to physically appear in a Jammu court for an abduction case.

117.title: 6 dead amid Kerala rains; CM says 'There could be crisis if heavy rainfall continues'
117.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Monday said that six people have died and one was missing amid heavy rains. "If this amount of rain continues...there could be a crisis," Vijayan added. As many as five houses have completely collapsed and 55 have partially collapsed. A 'red' alert has been issued for Thiruvananthapuram, Kollam, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam, Ernakulam and Idukki.

118.title: You won't okay first take, no: Chiranjeevi on Aamir's wish to do film with him
118.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan told actor Chiranjeevi he wants to do a movie with him. "Either I will direct or produce," Aamir said. "You won't okay the first take, no?" Chiranjeevi asked Khan, before also joking that he might end up giving 79 takes. Earlier, Khan had teased Chiranjeevi, saying he took actor Salman Khan for his film but not him.

119.title: Not happy with my performance: Harjinder after winning bronze at CWG
119.article_body: Following her bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category, Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur said she is "not happy" with her performance, though she is pleased about winning a medal. "I was confident...I will get a medal," she added. Harjinder's bronze medal has increased India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to nine. She lifted a total weight of 212 kg.

120.title: Our stand is nationalism, there's no question of discrimination: K'taka CM
120.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said BJP is a national party which emphasises upon nationalism. "There's no question of discrimination against anyone," he added. Bommai's remarks came after Congress and JD(S) targeted him for not visiting the homes of two Muslim men who were killed in Dakshina Kannada, even though he met the family of murdered BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru.

121.title: Chandigarh constable suspended after hitting helmetless biker
121.article_body: A constable of Chandigarh Police was suspended on Monday after CCTV footage showed him hitting a biker riding without helmet with his baton. A video of the incident was widely circulated on social media. The complainant stated he was forced to tell doctors that he sustained his injuries after falling from his motorcycle when he was taken for medical examination.

122.title: Pak helicopter carrying Army General, other officers goes missing
122.article_body: A Pakistani military helicopter with six people on board, including an Army General, went missing on Monday, the army said. The helicopter was on a flood relief operation in Balochistan when it lost contact with air traffic control (ATC), it added. Calling the incident "alarming", PM Shehbaz Sharif said the entire nation is praying for the return of those onboard.

123.title: We nearly made a mess of this as well: Pooran after win in final over vs India
123.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said that "a win is a win" after they secured victory in the second T20I against India in the 20th over of their innings. "We lost a few close games and nearly made a mess of this as well," he stated. WI chased down India's 138-run total with only four balls remaining in the game.

124.title: Agra youth jumps into Yamuna river after failing to get govt job
124.article_body: A youth jumped into the Yamuna river after failing to secure a government job on Sunday night, police said. The man, who was a resident of Agra, was also preparing for army recruitment. Police stated that he left a note on his WhatsApp status before jumping into the river. A search is on to recover his body.

125.title: 2 people arrested for killing realtor in Hyderabad's Madhapur
125.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Monday arrested two men who may have fired upon and killed realtor Mohammed Ismail in Hyderabad's Madhapur. The two, identified as Jilani and Feroz, were nabbed on the outskirts of Hyderabad. However, the prime accused in the case, Mujahid, is currently on the run. According to police, there were property disputes between the accused and deceased.

126.title: Leaders from rival group shouldn't play with Shiv Sainiks' sentiments: Anita Birje
126.article_body: Shiv Sena's newly appointed deputy leader Anita Birje on Monday said that leaders from the rival group should not play with the sentiments of Shiv Sainiks, who will rise to the occasion if anyone tries to do so. "We will follow the path set by late Shiv Sena supremo Balasaheb Thackeray, with 80% social work and 20% politics," Birje added.

127.title: 3 police officers threaten lawyer, extort ₹9 lakh in Gurugram; held
127.article_body: The Gurugram Police have arrested three police personnel, including a special police officer, for allegedly extorting ₹9 lakh from a lawyer, officials said. The complainant claimed that he was at a guest house when at least five people, including the police personnel, arrived there, took him hostage, threatened to lodge a false case against him and demanded money.

128.title: Mumbai's madrassa teacher sold stolen mobiles in Nepal, Bangladesh; held
128.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 32-year-old man who is one of the seven gang members involved in auctioning stolen mobiles to resellers from Nepal and Bangladesh after changing the IMEI numbers. The accused had a bank account in Nepal and used to work as an Urdu teacher at a madrassa in Kurla. He was part of 43 WhatsApp groups.

129.title: Elon Musk is planning to build his own private airport in Texas: Report
129.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk is reportedly planning to build his own private airport in Texas. As per the report, the airport will be used by Musk and his executives. Musk has based several of his companies, including SpaceX and The Boring Company, in Texas, and moved his Tesla headquarters from Silicon Valley to Texas in December.

130.title: Pelosi has right to visit Taiwan, China needn't turn it into a conflict: US
130.article_body: The White House has warned China against turning US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's potential visit to Taiwan into a "crisis or conflict", saying Pelosi "has the right to visit Taiwan". The White House also warned China might respond to Pelosi's mooted visit to Taiwan with military provocations, including by firing missiles near Taiwan. China claims Taiwan as its own territory.

131.title: Love it when people think 'She's so dumb', memes add to my popularity: Alia
131.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she loves it when people think that she is unintelligent or that "Oh, she is so dumb". "They make so many memes on me which add to [my] popularity...I also want to put out this message for young girls...general knowledge and bookish intelligence in my opinion is not intelligence," she added.

132.title: In-laws harass woman for not giving birth to boy in Pune; FIR filed
132.article_body: Pune's Chinchwad police have filed an FIR against a 28-year-old woman's in-laws for allegedly harassing and molesting her for not giving birth to a boy, officials said on Monday. The woman rushed to police to file a complaint following an incident on July 29, wherein she was apparently grabbed by her hair, beaten, verbally abused and molested by her in-laws.

133.title: I don't take this seriously: Kareena on 'Boycott Laal...' Twitter trend
133.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has reacted to the Twitter trend calling for a boycott of her upcoming movie 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Everyone has an opinion...if that is going to be there, then you have to learn to ignore certain things," she stated. Kareena added, "Otherwise, it'll...become impossible to live your life...that's why I don't take any of this like seriously."

134.title: I worked in many factories, tea stalls when I was young: Sudesh Lehri
134.article_body: Comedian Sudesh Lehri, recalling his childhood, revealed that he had circumstances when he was in poverty. "I used to work in small shops when I was young. I've worked in...many factories, tea stalls," he stated. Sudesh added he used to "quietly" have some tea before giving it to factory workers as there were days he couldn't have tea at home.

135.title: I've written to Tom Hanks if he's free & would watch 'Laal...': Aamir
135.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan revealed that he has written to Hollywood actor Tom Hanks if he would like to watch 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. The film is an official remake of Hanks' 'Forrest Gump'. "I've written to him if he's free...would like to watch the film. I have got feedback from his team that they're seeing his schedule for that," he stated.

136.title: Burglars drill hole in wall of jewellery shop in Pune, steal ornaments
136.article_body: Burglars stole gold ornaments worth ₹2.96 lakh by drilling a hole in the wall of a jewellery shop in Pune's Undri, police said. They entered the premises of a school, adjacent to the shop, and drilled a hole in the common wall, police added. The burglars also stole the digital video recorder in which the CCTV footage was captured.

137.title: Who was al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan?
137.article_body: Al Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri, 71, was a key architect behind multiple assaults on the US and was "deeply involved" in the planning of the September 11, 2001 attacks that killed 3,000 people. Born in 1951, he grew up in Egypt's upper-class neighbourhood. Zawahiri, a trained surgeon, became al Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

138.title: Suryakumar, Avesh wear Arshdeep’s jersey in 2nd T20I against West Indies, pics go viral
138.article_body: India cricketers Suryakumar Yadav and Avesh Khan were seen wearing Arshdeep Singh's jersey during the second T20I against West Indies. This came after the match was postponed twice due to logistics issues, with luggage not arriving on time. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "How many extra jerseys does he have?" Another tweet read, "Why are everyone wearing Arshdeep's jersey?"

139.title: Partha Chatterjee not cooperating, often complaining of tiredness: ED
139.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said that ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, who was arrested by the federal anti-money laundering agency in school job scam, has not been cooperating with sleuths. "He is often complaining of tiredness and avoiding our questions," an ED official told PTI. He remained silent most of the time during the questioning, the central probe agency added.

140.title: West Indies' McCoy breaks record for best-ever bowling figures against India in a T20I
140.article_body: West Indies pacer Obed McCoy has broken the record for best-ever T20I bowling figures against India. McCoy registered figures of 4-1-17-6 to set the record. Prior to him, no bowler had even taken a five-wicket haul against India in T20I cricket. McCoy's figures against India are also the best-ever T20I figures by a West Indies bowler.

141.title: Who are India's gold medal contenders at CWG 2022 for today?
141.article_body: India's Seema Punia and Navjeet Kaur Dhillon will participate in women's discus throw final on Day 5 of CWG 2022. India will face Malaysia in gold medal match of badminton mixed team event at 10 pm. India's lawn bowls women's fours final match will begin at 4.15 pm. India's table tennis men's team gold match will begin at 6 pm.

142.title: Violation of withdrawal agreement: Taliban as US strike in Kabul kills al-Qaeda chief
142.article_body: After the US announced that it has killed Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri in a drone strike in Afghanistan over the weekend, Taliban condemned it as a violation of "international principles" and the 2020 agreement on US troop withdrawal. Taliban spokesperson Zabihullah Mujahid said in a statement that the attack took place in Kabul on Sunday.

143.title: Air India brings new policy to allow pilots to fly till 65 amid fleet expansion
143.article_body: Air India has introduced a new policy wherein selected pilots will be given an extension of five years on a contract basis after their retirement amid the airline increasing number of aircraft in its fleet. While currently, the pilots retire at 58 at the company, the contract can be extended till the age of 65 years.

144.title: I have faced 'extreme misogyny' and 'casual sexism': Alia Bhatt
144.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she has faced "casual sexism" and "extreme misogyny" in the past, which has made her much more sensitive. "Sometimes my friends go like '...why have you become so aggressive?'" added Alia. "It's...just random things like 'don't be so sensitive'...are you PMSing. To hell with you...and even if I am PMSing so the hell what?" she stated.

145.title: Bengaluru reports 992 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
145.article_body: Bengaluru reported 992 new COVID-19 infections in a day, taking the cumulative total to 18,37,060 cases in the city, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said on Monday. No new deaths were reported, so the overall death toll remained at 16,975. The number of active cases was 8,325, while the infection positivity rate stood at 7.45%.

146.title: Loudspeaker which rang everyday at 8 am has stopped: Maharashtra CM
146.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Monday, without taking anyone's name, said the "loudspeaker" which rang everyday at 8 am is now stopped. "Hey, is...sound coming? Fix that loudspeaker. There'll be no sound," Shinde said. Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED on Sunday night after questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

147.title: Locals protest as minister says B'luru will be free of stray dogs
147.article_body: Weeks after Minister of Animal Husbandry Prabhu Chauhan said that Bengaluru will soon be free of stray dogs, locals held a protest at Freedom Park against the statement on Sunday. Calling the minister's claim misleading, Sujata Prasanna, a member of Action for Animal Justice, said there is no facility in the city that can accommodate lakhs of dogs.

148.title: Woman, 7-yr-old son returning from hospital run over by BEST bus, killed
148.article_body: A 27-year-old woman and her seven-year-old son were killed after being run over by a Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport (BEST) bus on Monday. Woman had taken her son to Sion hospital as he was suffering from cold, fever and cough for last two days. Reports said the victims did not see bus as it took sudden turn on road.

149.title: Who won medals for India at CWG 2022 on Day 4?
149.article_body: India won three medals on Day 4 of CWG 2022. Judoka Shushila Devi clinched a silver medal in the women's 48-kg category, becoming the first Indian to win multiple medals in judo in CWG history. Meanwhile, judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged bronze in the men's 60-kg category. Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category.

150.title: No matter where you hide, US will find you and take you out: Biden to terrorists
150.article_body: US President Joe Biden said, "No matter where you hide, if you're a threat to our people, the United States will find you and take you out." He added, "We shall never waver from defending our nation and its people." Biden's statement came as he announced that Al-Qaeda's Ayman al-Zawahiri had been killed in a CIA drone strike in Afghanistan.

151.title: Estee Lauder in talks to acquire Tom Ford for $3 billion or more: Report
151.article_body: Cosmetics company Estee Lauder is in talks to acquire luxury brand Tom Ford in what could be a $3 billion or more deal, as per a report. If the deal goes through, it will be Estee Lauder's biggest acquisition ever. Tom Ford is known for its menswear and also has women's wear, cosmetics and handbags as part of its products.

152.title: Thane girl who scored 81.60% in SSC despite battling cancer passes away
152.article_body: Divya Pavale from Thane, who scored 81.60% despite battling cancer during her SSC exams this year, passed away on Monday evening. Reports said that Divya was undergoing chemotherapy even a few days before her practical exams. A trustee of her school said that she was a happy-go-lucky girl and was going through a difficult phase for last few days.

153.title: Delhi to launch mobile health check-ups for workers at construction sites
153.article_body: Delhi government has decided to set up mobile health check-ups and creche facilities for workers at construction sites. The 'Doctors on Wheels' scheme will arrange for mobile vans in every district to visit various construction sites for routine health check-ups, the government said. The mobile creches will be set up for children of construction workers at work sites, it added.

154.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 9 medals?
154.article_body: India have bagged a total of nine medals at CWG 2022 so far and are placed sixth on the medal standings after Day 4. Australia lead the standings with 31 gold medals, followed by England (21) and New Zealand (13). As many as 26 nations/territories have clinched at least one medal at CWG 2022 so far.

155.title: WI take all 10 wickets vs India in a T20I for 1st time in history, level series 1-1
155.article_body: West Indies defeated India by five wickets in the second T20I to level the five-match series 1-1. Bowling first, West Indies dismissed India for 138 runs in 19.4 overs. This is the first time in men's T20I cricket history that West Indies took all 10 wickets against India in an innings. West Indies chased down the target in 19.2 overs.

156.title: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri killed in US drone strike in Afghanistan
156.article_body: Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri was killed in a drone strike by the US' CIA in Afghanistan on Sunday, President Joe Biden said. Zawahiri was a key plotter of the 9/11 terrorist attacks and took over as leader of the group after Osama bin Laden's death in 2011. "Justice has been delivered, and this terrorist leader is no more," Biden said.

157.title: Weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bags bronze, wins India's 9th medal at CWG 2022
157.article_body: Indian weightlifter Harjinder Kaur bagged bronze medal in the women's 71-kg category, taking India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to nine. Harjinder lifted a total of 212 kg, with 93 kg in snatch and 119 kg in clean and jerk. Out of India's nine medals at CWG 2022 so far, seven have come from weightlifting.

158.title: Defending champions India qualify for badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022
158.article_body: Defending champions India have qualified for the badminton mixed team gold medal match at CWG 2022. With this, India are assured of another medal. India defeated Singapore 3-0 in the semi-final of the event.  India will face Malaysia in the final on Tuesday. India have so far bagged eight medals at CWG 2022, including three gold medals.

159.title: India draw 4-4 vs England, concede 3 goals in 4th quarter in CWG men's hockey
159.article_body: Indian men's hockey team was held to a 4-4 draw against England in their second Pool B match at the Commonwealth Games on Monday. India were 4-1 ahead before England scored three goals in the fourth quarter. During the match, India reached a milestone of 100 goals in Commonwealth Games history following Mandeep Singh's goal in the 22nd minute.

160.title: Arunachal suspends residential proof certificates in Changlang
160.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh government on Monday issued an order suspending all residential proof certificates (RPC) issued in the Changlang district of the state. RPCs have been issued to members of the Chakma and Hajong communities who are yet to get Indian citizenship. This comes after students' body AAPSU threatened a strike over RPCs being issued to the two communities in Changlang.

161.title: Death toll due to floods in eastern Uganda rises to 24
161.article_body: The death toll due to the floods triggered by torrential rains in eastern Uganda reached 24 on Monday, authorities and Ugandan Red Cross informed. Uganda's government had confirmed 10 deaths due to the flooding in parts of Bugisu, Mbale and Kapchorwa on Sunday. 21 bodies have been recovered from Mbale and another three from Kapchorwa, Ugandan Red Cross told media.

162.title: Fintech startup Tartan raises $4.5 mn in pre-Series A round
162.article_body: Payroll management startup Tartan has raised $4.5 million in its pre-Series A funding round. The round saw participation from 500 Global, InfoEdge Ventures, Naval Ravikant-backed AngelList Quant Fund, WorldQuant Ventures, Varanium GenNext Fund, 9 Unicorns, Yatra Angel Network, Emphasis Ventures (EMVC) and Naveen Kukreja. Tartan was founded in 2021 and has raised $6 million.

163.title: Inmates in Meerut jail make flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign
163.article_body: Ahead of the 75th Independence Day, inmates of Meerut district jail have been making the national flags for 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. Jail superintendent Rakesh Kumar said that 30 male and 10 female inmates are making the flags. He further added that the national flag will be hoisted in all 39 barracks of the jail as part of the campaign.

164.title: TaxBuddy parent firm SSBA Innovations files ₹105 cr IPO papers
164.article_body: SSBA Innovations, which runs tax portal TaxBuddy, has filed papers with market regulator SEBI to raise ₹105 crore through an Initial Public Offering (IPO). As per the Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP), the IPO will be an entirely fresh issue of shares. The fintech company was incorporated in 2017 and owns two platforms — TaxBuddy and Finbingo.

165.title: Sushila Devi's CWG 2022 silver can start a big movement: Charu Sharma
165.article_body: Following Indian judoka Sushila Devi's silver medal at Commonwealth Games 2022, commentator Charu Sharma tweeted, "India's northeast has massive martial arts potential in the lighter weights. Sushila Devi proves it with a rare silver in Judo. Could start a big movement." The 27-year-old from Manipur won silver in 48 kg category on Monday in Birmingham.

166.title: Elon feels he's behind schedule, is frustrated with his progress: Father Errol Musk
166.article_body: Elon Musk's father Errol has said that his billionaire son "feels like he's behind schedule", adding, "Where he is now, he would have liked to have been there five years ago." He added that the SpaceX CEO is "not as happy as he'd like to be", adding, "He is frustrated with (his) progress and it's understandable."

167.title: Kohli would be amazing to adventure with: Grylls on who he wants on Man vs Wild
167.article_body: On being asked who he would like to have on his show 'Man vs Wild', British adventurer Bear Grylls said, "Virat Kohli would be amazing to adventure with, a true heart of a lion and kind spirit." Grylls has earlier hosted Prime Minister Narendra Modi, actors Rajinikanth and Ranveer Singh and other Indian celebrities on the show.

168.title: Sri Lanka's Navy rescues 6 Indian fishermen stranded in its waters
168.article_body: Sri Lanka's Navy on Monday rescued six Indian fishermen after their boat developed a mechanical snag and drifted into the country's territorial waters. The Indian boat's owner was contacted by the Sri Lankan Navy, ANI reported. The owner then dispatched a rescue vessel from Rameswaram that brought back the stranded boat and its crew, the report added.

169.title: Ukraine confirms latest delivery of rocket systems from Germany, US
169.article_body: Ukraine's defence minister on Monday confirmed the latest delivery of German and US-made multiple rocket launcher systems to the country. Ukraine has received four HIMARS rocket launchers as part of the latest weapons aid, he said. He also announced on Twitter, "The third brother in the Long Hand family - MLRS MARS II from Germany - has arrived in Ukraine."

170.title: Nigerian man tests positive for monkeypox in Delhi, 6th case in India
170.article_body: A Nigerian man in his 30s has tested positive for monkeypox in Delhi, hospital officials said on Monday. This is the second case of the virus in the national capital and the sixth in India. The man had no recent foreign travel history, officials of the LNJP hospital, where he was admitted, said. India today confirmed its first monkeypox death.

171.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against West Indies
171.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran won the toss and elected to bowl first against India in the second T20I in St Kitts. India have made one change to their playing XI, with leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi being replaced by Avesh Khan. Meanwhile, West Indies have made two changes to their playing XI. The match was delayed due to logistics issues.

172.title: 28-year-old man dies in AC explosion in Chennai
172.article_body: A 28-year-old Chennai man died after an air conditioner exploded in his house on Sunday night. A loud noise was heard from the deceased's room on Sunday night, following which his father and brother rushed to the spot, reports said. They broke the door open and found the deceased's body inside the room, reports added.

173.title: Bill introduced in Aus parliament to lift ban on assisted suicides
173.article_body: A bill proposing the reversal of a ban on doctor-assisted suicide in two Australian territories was introduced in the country's parliament on Monday. It seeks to legalise assisted suicide in the Northern Territory and Australian Capital Territory. In 1995, Northern Territory became world's first place to legalise voluntary euthanasia. The law was later overturned in 1997 by Australia's parliament.

174.title: Vijay Kumar Yadav clinches bronze in judo, takes India's medal tally at CWG 2022 to 8
174.article_body: Indian judoka Vijay Kumar Yadav bagged a bronze medal in men's 60-kg category at CWG 2022. With this, he took India's medal tally at CWG to eight. It is India's second medal in judo at the ongoing games after Shushila Devi's silver. India have bagged three gold medals, three silver medals and two bronze medals at CWG 2022 so far.

175.title: Oppn raising issue of price rise due to Modi-phobia: BJP in LS
175.article_body: While defending the Central government over the issue of price rise, BJP on Monday asked the Opposition to get over "Modi-phobia", adding that people should appreciate PM Modi for his handling of the COVID-19 situation. BJP member Nishikant Dubey said India is the only country which is exporting rice, wheat and sugar under the leadership of PM Modi.

176.title: Delhi reports 822 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate highest in 6 months at 11.41%
176.article_body: Delhi reported 822 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Monday and the positivity rate rose to 11.41%, which is the highest in the last six months.
