The national capital also reported two deaths in the last 24 hours. Delhi saw 1,263 fresh COVID-19 cases on Sunday, while the positivity rate stood at 9.35%.

177.title: Unlike in past, drug smuggling doesn't go undetected now: BJP
177.article_body: The BJP on Monday criticised Rahul Gandhi for his criticism of the government over the recovery of drugs at Gujarat's Mundra port, adding that unlike in the past, drug consignments don't go undetected now. BJP national spokesperson Sambit Patra also dubbed Gandhi a "vacation politician", alleging that the Congress leader doesn't go into the depth of any issue.

178.title: He'll remain at no. 3: Jaffer on Kohli's batting spot for T20 WC 2022
178.article_body: Talking about India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, beginning October 16, Wasim Jaffer said batter Virat Kohli will remain in his original number three spot. "KL Rahul and Rohit Sharma should open...other players like Rishabh Pant, Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan can contribute significantly to the squad," he added. Kohli has been rested for ongoing India-West Indies limited-overs series.

179.title: No need to create issue: Bihar minister as boy gets 151 out of 100 marks
179.article_body: After a college student in Bihar's Darbhanga was awarded 151 marks in a 100-mark paper, state Education minister Vijay Kumar Choudhary said it must have been a mistake and there was no need to create an issue. "There would be some misfeeding in the system or a typing error. We'll find out the person responsible for this," he said.

180.title: Bulgaria to hold snap poll on Oct 2; 4th parliamentary election in 2 years
180.article_body: Bulgaria's President Rumen Radev on Monday announced that the country will be holding an early parliamentary election on October 2. This comes following the collapse of former Prime Minister Kiril Petkov's coalition government after a no-confidence vote in June. The snap election will be Bulgaria's fourth parliamentary election in less than two years.

181.title: Shushila wins silver, becomes 1st Indian to bag multiple medals in judo in CWG history
181.article_body: Judoka Shushila Devi on Monday became the first-ever Indian to bag multiple medals in judo in the history of Commonwealth Games (CWG). The 27-year-old clinched silver at CWG 2022 after losing to Michaela Whitebooi of South Africa in the women's 48-kg category final. Shushila had bagged a silver medal at CWG 2014.

182.title: India has sufficient forex reserves; economic fundamentals are perfect: FM
182.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said India has sufficient foreign exchange reserves and India's economic fundamentals are perfect. Highlighting the strength of the Indian economy in the Parliament, Sitharaman said, "The government has acted to reduce cost of imports, drastically lowered duties on edible oils." No question of India slipping into stagflation or recession, she added.

183.title: India's Saurav Ghosal reaches men's singles semis in squash event at CWG
183.article_body: India's Saurav Ghosal entered the men's singles semi-final in the squash event at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham. Ghosal beat Greg Lobban of Scotland 3-1 in the quarter-final match on Monday. The 35-year-old won with a scoreline of 11-5, 8-11, 11-7, 11-3. Ghosal will face New Zealand's Paul Coll in the semi-final on Tuesday.

184.title: India Accelerator announces new co-working space in Noida
184.article_body: India Accelerator, a startup accelerator, announced the launch of their new co-working space in Noida. The centre, spread across 20,000 sq. ft., has a capacity of 250 seats. The firm, which already has four co-working spaces in Gurugram has invested ₹2.75 crore in this space. The company said that within four years of its inception, it registered a 25x growth.

185.title: Income Tax Department sets new record as over 72 lakh ITRs filed in one day
185.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Monday said that a new record was set after taxpayers filed 72.42 lakh IT returns for FY22 on Sunday (July 31). About 5.83 crore ITRs for the financial year have been filed till July 31, the Department further said. The ITR deadline for salaried individuals wasn't extended for the first time in three years.

186.title: Indian economy better placed than most countries due to govt, RBI: FM
186.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said the Indian economy is better placed than most countries due to various measures taken by the government and the RBI. India remains the fastest growing economy in assessment of global agencies like International Monetary Fund and World Bank, Sitharaman said. Efforts are being made to bring down retail inflation below 7%, she added.

187.title: 2nd West Indies-India T20I delayed again, to now start at 11 pm
187.article_body: The second West Indies-India T20I has been delayed again and will now start at 11 pm (IST). The match, originally scheduled to begin at 8 pm (IST) was initially postponed by two hours because of significant delays in "crucial" team luggage arriving into St Kitts from Trinidad. India lead the five-match series 1-0.

188.title: Irani & daughter didn't own Goa bar, Congress leaders' claims malicious: Delhi HC
188.article_body: The Delhi High Court has ruled that Union Minister Smriti Irani and her daughter Zoish never owned the Goa restaurant which Congress leaders alleged had an illegal bar license. It further said that the leaders' statements were "in the nature of slander...with malicious intent". The leaders were directed to remove the social media posts in which the allegations were made.

189.title: 7 tourists from Punjab drown in Himachal Pradesh's Gobind Sagar lake
189.article_body: Seven tourists from Punjab's Mohali drowned in the Gobind Sagar lake in Himachal Pradesh's Una district on Monday. As per the State Disaster Management Department, a group of 11 tourists from Punjab entered the lake to take bath. Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur expressed grief over the incident.

190.title: Men's coach sits for Indian women's TT team match at CWG, sparks controversy
190.article_body: A controversy erupted after men's coach S Raman sat for Indian women's TT team quarter-final match against Malaysia at CWG 2022. "This shouldn't have happened, women's coach should've been guiding...players," said SD Mudgil, member of the Committee of Administrators running the suspended TTFI. After their defeat, the women's team also avoided media interaction, which is a standard protocol.

191.title: Efforts on to misuse central agencies to silence truth: Rahul on Raut's arrest
191.article_body: Efforts are on to misuse central agencies to break Opposition's morale and to silence the truth, Congress' Rahul Gandhi said while reacting to Enforcement Directorate's arrest of Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut. "'King's' message is clear - those who speak against me will suffer...But the tyrants must listen. In the end, 'truth' will win and ego will lose," Gandhi tweeted.

192.title: Kerala Startup Mission-backed Alibi gets NABL accreditation
192.article_body: Private forensics lab Alibi Global Private Limited, backed by Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM), has received accreditation from the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL). The accreditation is for a period of two years, according to a KSUM press release. The startup, which works exclusively in cyber forensics, is the first cyber forensics private lab in India.

193.title: Tribal areas in Himachal saw unprecedented growth under BJP: CM
193.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jai Ram Thakur said that the tribal and hard areas of the state saw unprecedented growth under the BJP government. Addressing a delegation of the Bharmour-Pangi area, he said that the state government made adequate budget allocation for tribal and backward areas. He alleged that the Congress government used the tribal people as a vote bank.

194.title: UP woman throws baby in front of tractor to stop it amid dispute
194.article_body: A woman in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda threw her baby in front of a tractor. The driver averted the mishap and stopped the tractor right in time. The incident occurred over a property dispute between two brothers and one tried to plough the other's field and claim possession. To avoid this, the wife of one of the brothers threw her infant.

195.title: NZ cyclist Ellesse stripped of CWG silver medal for not attending ceremony, fined ₹16,000
195.article_body: New Zealand cyclist Ellesse Andrews has been stripped of her silver medal that she bagged along with her teammates in the women's 4,000m team pursuit event. She won't get the medal as she did not attend the ceremony. She was also fined CHF 200 (more than ₹16,000). However, she went on to win two gold medals in two other events.

196.title: TN Police to engage IT students for cyber crime investigation
196.article_body: The Coimbatore Police will join hands with IT students, who are specialising in artificial intelligence and ethical hacking for the investigation of cyber crimes. The police have also planned to establish a 'Cyber Club', which will be used to create cyber awareness among common people. The club will educate common people about how to stay away from modern cyber crimes.

197.title: African swine fever reported in 2 districts of Kerala
197.article_body: New cases of swine fever were reported in Kerala's Wayanad and Kannur districts, district officials said. One case each has been reported in the districts and the Kannur District Collector scheduled a meeting. The Deputy Director of Animal Husbandry in Wayanad said that 193 pigs in and around Nenmeni village, where the disease was reported, will be culled this week.

198.title: Buy only 'Made in India' flags: Pune foundation to citizens
198.article_body: Volunteers of the Bharat Flag Foundation in Pune are asking citizens to not use China-made Indian flags over those made locally. Pamphlets were given to residents and shopkeepers, and they were asked to celebrate Independence Day using 'Made in India' flags. Purchasing these flags would indirectly support the Chinese economy, said Rahul Bhalerao, Executive President of the Foundation.

199.title: Pune district sees highest COVID-19 jab 1st dose coverage in Maha
199.article_body: Pune district reported 106.05% of the first COVID-19 vaccine dose coverage in Maharashtra, which is the highest in the state. State immunisation officer, Dr Sachin Desai, said initiatives like Har Ghar Dastak and free booster vaccination for 18 years and above have urged people to get immunised. Pune has the second highest second dose coverage across the state at 90.67%.

200.title: Indian gymnast Pranati Nayak finishes 5th in women's vault final at CWG
200.article_body: Indian gymnast Pranati Nayak finished fifth in women's vault final with an average score of 12.699 at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Pranati scored 13.633 in her first attempt and 11.766 in her second. Australia's Georgia Godwin won a gold medal after scoring 13.233 points. Canada's Laurie Denommee won silver, while Scotland's Shannon Archer won bronze.

201.title: ED's 8-yr record shows its targeting only Oppn leaders: CM Baghel
201.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Monday said the track record of the ED in the last eight years showed it was only targeting leaders of Opposition parties. "It is clear those who will speak against the Centre will face action. The agency never takes action in BJP-ruled states or against its leaders or BJP-supported organisations," CM Baghel said.

202.title: India's squash player Joshna Chinappa loses in quarter-final at CWG
202.article_body: India's Joshna Chinappa lost in the women's singles quarter-final against Canada's Hollie Naughton 0-3 in the squash event at CWG 2022 in Birmingham. She lost with a scoreline of 9-11, 5-11, 13-15 on Monday. Chinappa has never won a gold medal in singles event at CWG. She won a gold with Dipika Pallikal in women's doubles at CWG 2014.

203.title: Woman gangraped & filmed at rehab centre, forced into prostitution in Rishikesh
203.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly gangraped by two men at a drug rehabilitation centre in Uttarakhand's Rishikesh, as per a police complaint. The woman who runs the centre allegedly filmed the assault and blackmailed the complainant using the video to force her into prostitution. Police have filed a case and an investigation is underway.

204.title: Absolutely no chance of India going into recession: Finance Minister
204.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during a price rise debate in Parliament said there is "absolutely zero probability of India slipping into recession" or stagflation. "Pandemic, [COVID-19] second wave, Omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...in spite of [all this], we've held inflation within 7% or below. That has to be recognised," said Sitharaman. The Indian economy has recovered admirably, she said.

205.title: Congress MPs walk out of Lok Sabha as FM Sitharaman speaks on rising prices
205.article_body: Congress MPs walked out of the Lok Sabha as Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman spoke on rising prices on Monday. "Pandemic, second wave, omicron, Russia-Ukraine (war)...even today largest supply components in China are under lockdown...in spite of that, we have held inflation well within 7% or below," she said. Sitharaman added that this has to be recognised.

206.title: RIL-owned logistics startup Grab.in integrates with ONDC
206.article_body: Reliance Retail owned logistics startup Grab.in has joined its platform with the Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC) network, a senior executive at the company said. The e-commerce platform is a subsidiary of Reliance Retail since its acquisitions by Reliance Industries in 2019. Prior to this, Reliance-backed Dunzo joined ONDC as a logistics partner.

207.title: US House Speaker Pelosi will visit Taiwan despite Chinese warnings: Reports
207.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi will visit Taiwan during her Asia tour, despite Chinese warnings, US media reported on Monday. The visit is definite, the Wall Street Journal reported, quoting a person familiar with the matter. China has said its military won't "sit idly by" if the top US official visits Taiwan, which it considers its own territory.

208.title: Made a mistake, forgive me: Maha Guv on 'Gujarati-Rajasthani' remark
208.article_body: Following criticism over his Gujarati-Rajasthani remarks, Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari on Monday said, "I have made a mistake." Last week, he had said, "If Gujaratis and Rajasthanis are removed from Maharashtra...no money would be left here." "I don't even imagine that if I made any mistake unintentionally...that mistake would be considered as an insult to...Maharashtra," he added.

209.title: Who were the top bidders as govt sells 5G spectrum for over ₹1.5 lakh crore?
209.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction concluded on Monday after seven days, with a total bid amount of ₹1,50,173 crore. Reliance Jio emerged the top bidder, acquiring 24,740 MHz spectrum worth ₹88,078 crore. Bharti Airtel acquired 19,867 MHz spectrum worth ₹43,084 crore. Vodafone Idea's bid was worth ₹18,799 crore, while Adani Group acquired 400 MHz spectrum worth ₹212 crore.

210.title: Indian IPO market for tech startups is nascent: Lightspeed's Somaia
210.article_body: Venture capital firm Lightspeed's de facto head of India operations, Bejul Somaia, in an interview said the IPO market for Indian tech companies is still nascent. Calling last year's tech IPOs a positive development, he said that the market still needed to deepen. With companies like Udaan, OYO, Razorpay, etc in its portfolio, Lightspeed recently closed a $500 million fund.

211.title: Centre forms special task force to monitor monkeypox cases
211.article_body: The Centre has formed a special task force to monitor monkeypox cases, officials said. The task force, which will be headed by NITI Aayog member (health) VK Paul, will also coordinate cases from states and provide any expertise that the states need. A 22-year-old man who had tested positive for monkeypox in the UAE died in Kerala's Thrissur on Saturday.

212.title: ED took action against Raut based on evidence: Maha Dy CM Fadnavis
212.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Monday said the ED's action against Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was based on certain proofs and documents. "I would not comment on this issue further. His arrest and other related issues will be discussed in the court," said Fadnavis. Raut was arrested on Sunday night in connection with the Patra Chawl scam case.

213.title: TMC MP bites raw brinjal during Parliament debate on price rise, video released
213.article_body: TMC MP Kakoli Ghosh Dastidar on Monday bit on a raw brinjal during a Parliament debate on price rise. A video of the incident was released online, in which she's heard saying, "I'm talking about eating raw vegetables because LPG cylinder [price] has risen four times in four months." Government must understand what citizens are going through, she said.

214.title: Indian squash player Kuruvilla enters women's singles plate semis at CWG
214.article_body: Indian squash player Sunayna Kuruvilla beat Sri Lanka's Chanithma Sinaly 3-0 to reach the women's singles plate semi-final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 on Monday. Kuruvilla won the quarter-final match with a scoreline of 11-3, 11-2, 11-2. The 23-year-old will face Pakistan's Faiza Zafar on Tuesday. Zafar beat Guyana's Ashley Khalil 3-2 in the quarter-final.

215.title: Amber sells her home in US' California for $1.05 mn to pay Johnny Depp: Reports
215.article_body: Actress Amber Heard has reportedly sold her home in US' California after losing a defamation trial against ex-husband Johnny Depp in which she was ordered to pay him $8.3 million in damages. The property in Yucca Valley has been sold for $1.05 million (around ₹8.3 crore), reports said, adding that she bought it in 2019 for $5,70,000 (around ₹4.5 crore).

216.title: Have taken various steps to make India 'global drone hub' by 2030: Govt
216.article_body: The government has undertaken a series of reform measures to make India a global drone hub by 2030, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said on Monday. Singh added that the Drone Airspace Map was published on September 24, 2021, opening up nearly 90% of Indian airspace as green zone for drones flying up to 400 feet.

217.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
217.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

218.title: Zomato's consolidated loss nearly halves to ₹186 cr in Apr-Jun quarter
218.article_body: Zomato's consolidated net loss fell 47.8% YoY from ₹356.2 crore in Q1 FY22 to ₹185.7 crore in Q1 FY23. Zomato's consolidated revenue stood at ₹1,413.9 crore, rising by 67.44% YoY from ₹844.4 crore. Zomato CFO Akshant Goyal said growth in the food delivery platform's revenue was driven by a nearly 10% quarter-on-quarter growth in gross order value.

219.title: K'taka govt issues circular to check spread of monkeypox infection
219.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Sudhakar K on Monday said a circular has been issued to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike and all district administrations as a precautionary measure to check the spread of monkeypox infection. As per the circular, authorities have been asked to ensure enhanced surveillance, designated institutional isolation facilities, mandatory contact tracing and testing of samples.

220.title: Boxer Hussamuddin enters quarters in 57 kg featherweight at CWG 2022
220.article_body: Indian boxer Mohammed Hussamuddin reached the quarter-final in men's 57 kg featherweight category at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Monday. Hussamuddin beat Bangladesh's Md Salim Hossain 5-0 in the round of 16. Earlier in the day, India's Amit Pangal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri 5-0 to enter the quarter-final in men's 51 kg flyweight category.

221.title: There was never a minute when I had headache as Delhi Police chief: Asthana
221.article_body: Former Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana has said that there was never a minute when he had headache and wanted to quit the force. "Although I've retired today, I still believe I can do a lot more for the Delhi Police, the people and the country," he added. Senior IPS officer Sanjay Arora took charge as the new Commissioner.

222.title: 2nd West Indies-India T20I postponed by 2 hours as team luggage doesn't arrive on time
222.article_body: The second West Indies-India T20I has been postponed by two hours and is now scheduled to begin at 10 pm tonight, instead of 8 pm at Warner Park in St Kitts today. Cricket West Indies (CWI) said that the match has been postponed because of significant delays in "crucial" team luggage arriving into St Kitts from Trinidad.

223.title: Video of Paytm employees burning PhonePe's QR codes surfaces, police complaint lodged
223.article_body: UPI leader PhonePe filed a police complaint against some employees of Paytm, alleging that they burnt PhonePe's QR codes. The incident is said to have taken place in Greater Noida. A video of the incident has surfaced online. PhonePe said that it identified three Paytm employees, including an ex-PhonePe employee. Paytm said it suspended the employees pending a detailed investigation.

224.title: Raut is the Shiv Sainik who won’t bend: Uddhav on Raut’s arrest
224.article_body: Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray on Monday said that he's proud of Sanjay Raut, adding that he's a real Shiv Sainik who won't bend. “There’s a dialogue in ‘Pushpa’ - “jhukega nahi”. Those who used to say they won’t bend are all that side today.” he said. Thackeray criticised the BJP for trying to muzzle the voices of dissent.

225.title: Delhi man intensifies crime to buy scooter for sister on Raksha Bandhan
225.article_body: A 21-year-old history-sheeter allegedly intensified his criminal activities in Delhi, so that he could buy an electric scooter for his sister on Raksha Bandhan, police said on Monday. With the accused's arrest, police claim to have solved six criminal cases, and also recovered three stolen mobile phones and a motorcycle from him.

226.title: B'luru to see regular power cuts in August due to maintenance work
226.article_body: Bengaluru is expected to witness regular power cuts throughout August due to maintenance work by Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation Limited. According to Bengaluru's power distribution company BESCOM, the work will be undertaken nearly every day of the month from 9 am to 6 pm. As per BESCOM, its Koramangala, Indiranagar, Kanakapura and Whitefield divisions, among others, will be affected.

227.title: Teen dies after drowning in swimming pool in Hyderabad's Narsingi
227.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died on Sunday after drowning in a swimming pool at a gated community in Hyderabad's Narsingi, police informed. According to police, the boy was pulled out of the pool by his cousin who saw him struggling in the water on Saturday when they visited the pool. The teenager was later hospitalised but died during treatment, police added.

228.title: Realtor shot dead by business associate in Hyderabad's Madhapur
228.article_body: A real estate dealer named Mohammad Ismail was allegedly shot dead by his business associate over a suspected property dispute in Hyderabad's Madhapur area during the early hours of Monday. Police found in its preliminary probe that both the victim and the accused had several criminal cases registered against them. The accused and his associate are absconding, police said.

229.title: Bengaluru reports 1,154 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 7.3%
229.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,154 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 7.31% on Sunday, data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath said. As per the data, no new deaths were recorded due to the infection in the city on Sunday. Bengaluru's active case count stands at 8,595, data showed.

230.title: The more I bowled spin, the more I looked at Muralidaran: Narine
230.article_body: KKR spinner Sunil Narine revealed that he used to look up to Sri Lankan spinner Muthiah Muralidaran when the former was starting out his career as a spin bowler. "The more I bowled spin, the more I looked to Muralidaran...he had the ball going both ways. But in the beginning, it was tough [in West Indies]," Narine said.

231.title: 2nd seed Sinner beats top seed Alcaraz to win 1st title of 2022 in Croatia
231.article_body: Second-seeded Jannik Sinner beat top-seeded Carlos Alcaraz 6-7(5-7), 6-1, 6-1 to win Plava Laguna Croatia Open Umag on Sunday. It was the 20-year-old's first title of the season. "I'm obviously very happy. I have (had) a tough year until now," said Sinner. The win was the Italian's second against Alcaraz in four weeks. Overall, it was Sinner's sixth title.

232.title: Google Maps to share speed limit info with users in B'luru, Chandigarh
232.article_body: Google Maps will now display speed limit information to its users in Bengaluru and Chandigarh as part of a partnership between Google and the traffic police departments of Bengaluru and Chandigarh. Google will reportedly extend the pilot project to Kolkata and Hyderabad in the coming months. The project has already reduced 20% wait time for commuters, Bengaluru traffic police said.

233.title: Judoka Shushila Devi assures India of another CWG medal, to fight for gold tonight
233.article_body: Judoka Shushila Devi has assured India of another medal at the ongoing Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. She defeated Mauritian judoka Priscilla Morand by IPPON in the semi-final of the women's 48-kg category to reach the final. She will face Michaela Whitebooi of South Africa in the gold medal match after 9.30 pm (IST) tonight.

234.title: Tesla CEO Musk says engagement on Twitter has dropped recently
234.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said interaction with almost all Twitter accounts "seem to be much lower in recent weeks and days". Musk asked in a tweet if users think his analysis is "accurate". Reacting to Musk's tweet, a user wrote, "Nah, Elon. We're just actively ignoring you." Another user wrote, "It's because markets have been down. It'll come back."

235.title: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction ends, total bids cross ₹1.5 lakh crore
235.article_body: India's first-ever 5G spectrum auction has concluded, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said on Monday. The total bid amount for the sale of airwaves was over ₹1.5 lakh crore at the end of the auction. Out of the 72 GHz of the spectrum that was put up for auction, around 51 GHz has been sold, Vaishnaw said.

236.title: Death toll in fire at Madhya Pradesh hospital rises to 9
236.article_body: At least nine people died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Monday, Superintendent of Police (SP) Siddharth Bahuguna said. Two injured persons have been shifted to a nearby hospital for treatment. The SP said prima facie, it appears that a short circuit caused the blaze. The fire has been doused.

237.title: He would cry for meat, but we couldn't afford it: Mother of CWG gold medallist Achinta
237.article_body: After Indian weightlifter Achinta Sheuli bagged gold medal for India at CWG 2022, his mother Purnima said, "If one day he had rice on his plate, then he would not have any vegetables with it." She added, "Some days it would be eggs, while meat was something my son would cry for, but we could not afford it."

238.title: Pune Police rolls back guidelines for Ganesh Chaturthi festival
238.article_body: The Pune Police has rolled back its guidelines for the upcoming 10-day Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations, three days after issuing them. "Considering the demands raised by Ganpati mandals, we will soon issue fresh guidelines for this year's Ganpati festival," said Pune Police Joint Commissioner Sandeep Karnik. Earlier, only two box 'kamans' were permitted per Ganpati mandal in the city.

239.title: Amit Panghal enters quarterfinals in flyweight category at CWG 2022
239.article_body: Indian boxer Amit Panghal defeated Vanuatu's Namri Berri to enter the quarterfinals in the men's 48kg-51kg (flyweight) category at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 on Monday. Panghal won the round of 16 in a unanimous decision (5-0). The 26-year-old will next face Scottish boxer Lennon Mulligan in the quarterfinals.

240.title: Sanjay Raut tampered with evidence: ED in its 8-day custody plea
240.article_body: Seeking eight-day custody for Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut, the ED in its plea said that Raut was tampering with evidence and influenced several crucial witnesses in the money laundering case. ED was granted custody of Raut till August 4, who was arrested on Sunday night in a money laundering case related to the Patra Chawl land scam case.

241.title: Andhra ex-CM NTR's daughter Uma found dead at her Hyderabad home
241.article_body: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) founder and former CM of Andhra Pradesh NT Rama Rao's (NTR's) daughter Uma Maheshwari was found dead at her residence in Hyderabad on Monday. Uma was the youngest among actor-turned-politician NTR's 12 children. Her body has been shifted to a local hospital for postmortem, reports said.

242.title: Delhi BJP leaders sit on dharna outside Kejriwal's home
242.article_body: Delhi BJP leaders sat on a dharna outside CM Arvind Kejriwal's home demanding that Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and minister Satyendar Jain be removed over charges of alleged corruption. Jain is currently in judicial custody in a case of alleged money laundering registered by the Enforcement Directorate (ED). Kejriwal was in Gujarat to address a public rally in Rajkot.

243.title: MP CM announces ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh for families of 4 killed in hospital fire
243.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday announced ex-gratia of ₹5 lakh each for the families of four people who died after a massive fire broke out at a private hospital in Jabalpur. At least three other people were seriously injured in the fire. The fire began at the entrance of the hospital located near Shiv Nagar Damoh Naka.

244.title: Uddhav backs Sanjay Raut, calls him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’
244.article_body: After Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut’s arrest, former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray criticised BJP and claimed that the saffron party is trying to muzzle voices of the dissent. "Using CBI, ED and other agencies to repress dissent is not democracy,” said Uddhav. He further added that he is proud of Raut and called him a true ‘Shiv Sainik’.

245.title: China warns its military 'won't sit idly' if Pelosi visits Taiwan
245.article_body: Chinese Foreign Ministry, during a regular briefing, has said that its military "won't sit idly" if US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan. A spokesperson of the ministry said that due to Pelosi's status as "No 3 official of US government", a visit to Taiwan would "lead to egregious political impact". This comes as Pelosi began an Asian tour.

246.title: Boeing to develop research facility in Japan to develop sustainable fuel
246.article_body: Boeing will establish a research and development centre in Japan with an aim to further develop sustainable aviation fuel (SAF). In a news release, US aircraft manufacturer said that the facility will focus on robotics, digitalisation and automation. Sustainable aviation fuel uses feedstock like animal fat and cooking oil which is more expensive than conventional jet fuel.

247.title: 20 quarantined in Kerala after youth dies of monkeypox
247.article_body: Following the death of a person due to monkeypox in Kerala, 20 people have been put under quarantine in Thrissur. “The situation is under control, there's no panic here. The deceased had direct contact with 10 people including the family members,” officials said. Meanwhile, the Centre formed a task force on monkeypox to closely monitor the situation in the country.

248.title: 126 Venezuelan migrants including 9 women deported from Mexico
248.article_body: Mexico has deported 126 Venezuelan migrants, including nine women, who were not able to prove their legal entry, the country's National Migration Institute said in a statement. The migrants boarded a flight early Saturday, it added. According to the UN, over six million Venezuelans have fled from their home country to escape violence as well as lack of essential services.

249.title: Holiday for educational institutions in parts of Kerala amid rains
249.article_body: A holiday has been declared for educational institutions in parts of Kerala on Monday amid heavy rainfall. District Collectors of Pathanamthitta and Kollam declared August 1 as a holiday for educational institutions in certain taluks in their respective districts. In Ernakulam, all departments have been directed to be prepared and fishermen have been instructed not to venture into the sea.

250.title: Shooting while pregnant was quite a task: Alia on 'Heart of Stone'
250.article_body: Speaking about her upcoming Hollywood film 'Heart of Stone', actress Alia Bhatt said that she had quite a task at hand since she was pregnant during the shoot. She added that there were many layers for her to deal with due to her pregnancy. "But they made it so seamless and so easy and so comfortable for me," Alia said.

251.title: Gambhir asked me to open, opposition didn't take me seriously: Sunil Narine
251.article_body: Talking about his batting, West Indies spinner Sunil Narine said he was first tried out as an opener in BBL, and then Gautam Gambhir asked him to open for KKR in IPL 2017. "Gambhir wanted me to get the team off to a fast start...opposition didn't take me that seriously...[but] I went from strength to strength," added Narine.

252.title: Dalit woman sexually harassed, forced to undress at gunpoint in UP; 7 arrested
252.article_body: A 30-year-old Dalit woman was allegedly sexually harassed and forced to remove her clothes at gunpoint in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar. The miscreants also recorded the act on a mobile phone camera, police said. The matter came to the fore after the incident's video was circulated on social media. Police arrested seven persons in connection with the incident on Sunday.

253.title: National Awards jury members are just Bollywood fans: Adoor Gopalakrishnan
253.article_body: Filmmaker Adoor Gopalakrishnan has stated that now the National Awards jury comprises anonymous Bollywood fans "playing...jokes". He further said that earlier the jury consisted of well-known directors, theatre artists and critics. "[Now] some random person becomes the chairman of the jury that gives awards to some people...everyone knows the exact reason (why they got the awards)," he added.

254.title: 1st ship carrying Ukrainian grain since war began leaves Odesa
254.article_body: A ship carrying Ukrainian grain left the port of Odesa on Monday, the first departure since the Russian invasion blocked shipping. This comes after Russia and Ukraine signed separate agreements with Turkey and the UN to resume Ukrainian grain export. "It's important for us to be one of the guarantors of food security," Ukrainian Infrastructure Minister Oleksandr Kubrakov said.

255.title: 169 dengue cases so far this year in Delhi, highest since 2017
255.article_body: Nearly 170 dengue cases have been reported in Delhi this year till July 30, the highest for the period since 2017, according to a civic body report released on Monday. In 2015, Delhi witnessed a massive outbreak of dengue, with the number of cases crossing 10,600 in October alone. It was Delhi's worst dengue outbreak since 1996.

256.title: It was our worst performance: Pooran on WI's 1st T20I loss vs India
256.article_body: West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran called his side's first T20I loss against India as the worst performance. "We knew something like this was going to happen," he added. Chasing 191, West Indies managed to score 122/8 in 20 overs. With 20 runs off 15 balls, Shamarh Brooks was the top-scorer for West Indies. India beat West Indies by 68 runs.

257.title: Centre taking steps to make India global drone hub by 2030: VK Singh to RS
257.article_body: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh told the Rajya Sabha on Monday that the Centre has undertaken various steps to make India a global drone hub by 2030. Replying to a query, Singh said, "Drone Airspace Map was published...last year, opening up nearly 90% of Indian airspace as a green zone for drones flying up to 400 feet."

258.title: DeHaat fires employees less than a year after raising $115 million
258.article_body: DeHaat has laid off 500 employees less than a year after securing $115 million in the largest funding round for an Indian agritech startup, Moneycontrol reported. Responding to the report, DeHaat CEO Shashank Kumar said that the number of employees affected is not in triple digits. "It was a corrective measure around performances and due to culture misfit," Kumar added.

259.title: Massive fire breaks out at MP hospital, 4 killed & 3 seriously injured
259.article_body: At least four people have died in a massive fire that broke out at a private hospital in MP's Jabalpur on Monday. An official said that at least three other people were seriously injured in the fire and that operations to save those trapped in the fire were underway. A short circuit could be the fire's cause, the official said.

260.title: Woman narrates atmosphere of football stadium to visually impaired son in Brazil
260.article_body: A video showing a woman describing the atmosphere of a football stadium before a match to her visually impaired son in Brazil has gone viral. "Son, there are flags over there...lots of Avaí fans, back here there are Flamengo fans," the woman is heard saying in the video. "We are behind the goal. Do you understand, my love?" she added.

261.title: 25-yr-old daughter of Congress leader Feroz Khan dies after car hits divider in T'gana
261.article_body: Congress leader Feroz Khan's 25-year-old daughter Tanya Kakde died in a road accident in Telangana's Shamshabad. Tanya was travelling with her friends to Hyderabad when her car hit a road divider. "She was immediately shifted to Osmania Hospital, where the doctors declared her brought dead," police said. A case has been registered.

262.title: 15-year-old girl beheads her 9-year-old relative with a sword in Rajasthan
262.article_body: A 15-year-old girl beheaded her nine-year-old niece with a sword in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district, with her family saying that she wasn't "behaving normally" for two days. As per police, the attack happened on Monday morning when the Class 10 girl and her family were performing puja at their home. The body of the victim has been sent for post-mortem.

263.title: Varun wraps Nitesh's 'Bawaal' in Poland, film to release in April 2023
263.article_body: Varun Dhawan has finished filming for his upcoming movie 'Bawaal' in Poland, the actor announced on Monday. Taking to Instagram, he shared a video announcing the wrap and shared that the film, being directed by Nitesh Tiwari, will release in theatres on April 7, 2023. In addition to Varun, 'Bawaal' will also feature Janhvi Kapoor.

264.title: Angad Bedi to star opposite Mrunal Thakur in 'Lust Stories 2': Report
264.article_body: Actor Angad Bedi will reportedly star opposite Mrunal Thakur in director R Balki's segment of the anthology film, 'Lust Stories 2'. The upcoming project will mark Angad and Balki's second collaboration after 'Ghoomer', an upcoming film starring Abhishek Bachchan, Shabana Azmi and Saiyami Kher. Angad will reportedly start working on Balki's segment from August 7 in Mumbai.

265.title: 7-yr-old critically injured as leopard tries to drag him into forest in UP
265.article_body: A seven-year-old boy was critically injured after a leopard attacked and tried to drag him into the forest in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha district. The boy was saved after villagers heard him scream and rushed to save him. Hearing the commotion, the leopard left the boy and escaped into the forest. The boy suffered deep wounds on his neck and head.

266.title: Govt engineer arrested to taking bribe of ₹50,000 in Rajasthan
266.article_body: A junior engineer working under the Rajasthan government was arrested for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹50,000 in the state's Chittorgarh district. The accused, Phoolchand Swami, was caught red-handed by an Anti-Corruption Bureau team, an official said. Swami had demanded the money from a contractor to clear the latter's outstanding bills amounting to ₹48 lakh.

267.title: Brokerage firm's director, owners arrested in Mumbai for cheating investors
267.article_body: A brokerage firm's director and its owners have been arrested by the Mumbai Police after it was found that the firm had allegedly cheated its investors to the tune of ₹1.54 crore. Three accused, Sunil, Dhiren and Anurag, have been arrested while a fourth accused, Jairaj, is absconding, police said. Notably, the firm cheated people while managing their trading accounts.

268.title: Indian weightlifter Ajay Singh lifts 319 kg at CWG, misses medal by 1 kg
268.article_body: Indian weightlifter Ajay Singh on Monday finished fourth in the men's 81-kg category at CWG 2022. The 25-year-old lifted a total of 319 kg, with 143 kg in snatch and 176 kg in the clean jerk. He attempted a 180-kg lift in his last attempt in clean and jerk but failed to lift and missed a medal by 1 kg.

269.title: Debris from SpaceX rocket launched in 2020 falls on sheep farm in Aus; pics released
269.article_body: Debris from a SpaceX rocket crashed onto a sheep farm in Australia on July 9. An astrophysicist said the debris belonged to the SpaceX Crew-1 Trunk capsule, launched in 2020. When a rocket is launched, pieces of the spacecraft often separate from the primary payload and either burn up due to friction with Earth's atmosphere or land in oceans instead.

270.title: Atul, Aditya said newcomer shouldn't do 'Laal..': Aamir on Junaid's test video
270.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that a test video with his son Junaid was shot for 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and that he was blown away by it. He said that people said he should take Junaid in the film. However, Khan said that scriptwriter Atul and filmmaker Aditya Chopra said a newcomer shouldn't do the film.

271.title: Didn’t have distributors for 'My Brother...'; Karan, Aditya helped me: Onir
271.article_body: Filmmaker Onir, in his memoir 'I Am Onir & I Am Gay', revealed he struggled to distribute his film 'My Brother...Nikhil'. He added producer-actor Sanjay Suri asked Karan Johar to watch the film. Onir said Karan loved the film, however, he didn't have the infrastructure to release the film. He stated Karan called Aditya Chopra, who agreed to distribute it.

272.title: There's scope that India will win more medals at CWG 2022: Anurag Thakur
272.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said there's scope that India will win more medals in ongoing Commonwealth Games 2022. "I'd like to congratulate Indian weightlifters and all other athletes of Commonwealth Games...our hopes have been ascended and we'll be winning more accolades in the coming time," he added. India have won three gold, two silver and one bronze medals so far.

273.title: UP school makes students recite Kalma for 'equality'; probe ordered
273.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police and administration reached Kanpur's Florets International School on Monday after a video allegedly showing Hindu students being made to recite 'Kalma', an Islamic oath of allegiance, surfaced online. "We have prayers for all four religions. We want to teach students that all religions are equal," the school's principal clarified. An inquiry has been ordered into the matter.

274.title: Seth Rogen told me to watch 'RRR', I highly recommend it: Actor's mom
274.article_body: Sandy Rogen, mother of filmmaker-actor Seth Rogen, wrote on Twitter, "Seth told us to watch this movie on Netflix called 'RRR'. Well, I highly recommend it." Several Hollywood celebrities, including 'Doctor Strange' writer Jon Spaihts and filmmaker Joe Russo, have praised the film. 'RRR' finished runner-up in the Best Picture category at the Hollywood Critics Association Midseason Awards.

275.title: We're focused on our target: Captain Savita on match vs England at CWG
275.article_body: Ahead of their third Pool A game against England on Tuesday in the ongoing CWG 2022, Indian women's hockey team captain Savita Punia has said though the English side will have the home advantage, they are focused on their target. "It'll be all about getting the basics right...It's a crucial game and we're focused on our target," she added.

276.title: Attempt to divert attention from SSC scam: Malviya on WB to get 7 new districts
276.article_body: Soon after West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that the state Cabinet has approved a proposal to carve out seven new districts, BJP’s Amit Malviya said that it is an attempt to divert attention from the SSC scam. "She must explain [from] where a debt-trapped West Bengal government gets money to run new districts?" he asked.

277.title: Poor getting 2-time free meals in India when other countries facing crisis: BJP MP
277.article_body: Addressing Lok Sabha, BJP MP Nishikant Dubey said that we should be thankful to PM Narendra Modi as poor in India are getting two-time meals free of cost. "If we see Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Singapore, everywhere inflation is rising...Amid such a situation if poor are getting two-time meals free of cost then shouldn't we thank PM," he said.

278.title: LeBron James invests in Germany's bike maker Canyon Bicycles
278.article_body: Four-time NBA champion LeBron James has invested in Germany-based Canyon Bicycles through his family office LRMR Ventures. Canyon Bicycles, which manufactures a range of motorcycles and mountain bikes, said it has raised $30.5 million in funding from LRMR Ventures and US private equity firm SC Holdings. "LRMR and the SC team immediately understood our mission," Canyon's Founder Roman Arnold said.

279.title: History-sheeter killed in moving car in Hyd over property dispute
279.article_body: A man involved in at least 10 criminal cases was shot dead in Hyderabad in a moving car in what is suspected to be the fallout of a property dispute, police said. The deceased was travelling in a car with the accused on the pretext of a meeting. The discussion led to heated arguments, following which the deceased was shot.

280.title: 300 firefighters battle wildfire in France's Gard; 4 injured
280.article_body: Four firefighters were injured, two of whom were treated for burn injuries, while battling a wildfire in Aubais in France's Gard on Sunday, French Interior Minister said. About 300 firefighters were tackling the blaze, which burned 250 hectares of pine forest, authorities added. The wildfire was "very violent" due to strong winds and dry weather, a fire service spokesperson said.

281.title: SP names tribal candidate for UP council bypolls
281.article_body: Samajwadi Party has fielded tribal candidate Kirti Kol for the August 11 bypolls to the UP Legislative Council. She is the daughter of former MP Bhailal Kol. The two seats for which by-elections will be conducted, became vacant after the death of SP's Ahmad Hassan and resignation of BJP's Thakur Jaiveer Singh.

282.title: Eknath Shinde govt in Maha will collapse for sure: Aaditya Thackeray
282.article_body: Maharashtra never tolerates treachery and the Eknath Shinde-led government will collapse for sure, Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said on Monday. Aaditya added that the focus of the Shinde government is on "dirty politics" and not the welfare of the people of Maharashtra. The state witnessed incessant rains and floods, but the government is not bothered, he alleged.

283.title: HC reserves order on ex-Haryana CM's plea for suspension of sentence
283.article_body: Delhi High Court has reserved order on ex-Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala's plea seeking suspension of the four-year sentence imposed on him in a disproportionate assets case. "He's 88 and the appeal cannot be decided in one go," his advocate said. In May, a trial court awarded him a four-year jail term for acquiring disproportionate assets from 1993 to 2006.

284.title: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut sent to ED custody till August 4
284.article_body: A special court on Monday granted the custody of Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) till August 4 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. Earlier, the ED had sought an 8-day custody of Raut. ED's lawyer claimed that Raut was summoned four times but he appeared before the agency only once.

285.title: Nushrratt to start shooting for 'Chhorii 2' in November: Report
285.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha will reportedly start shooting for the sequel to 'Chhorii' in November this year. The story of 'Chhorii 2' will continue from part one and take on a new dimension, Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying. 'Chhorii', a horror film directed by Vishal Furia, was a remake of a Marathi film titled 'Lapachhapi'.

286.title: 'Fast X' director Leterrier is dope, we're lucky to have him: Michelle
286.article_body: Actress Michelle Rodriguez, speaking about the 'Fast X' director Louis Leterrier, has said, "He's so dope, man...We're...lucky to have him." She added Leterrier came with an "energy of love". "We haven't had that in 'Fast and Furious' for a...long time where we get somebody excited who's a real fan," she added. Leterrier replaced Justin Lin as the film's director.

287.title: Probing head of country's largest chip investment fund: China's watchdog
287.article_body: China's corruption watchdog said it was probing Ding Wenwu, the head of China Integrated Circuit Industry Investment Fund, China's largest state-backed chip investment fund. Wenwu is "suspected of serious violation of the law" and is "currently undergoing disciplinary review", the watchdog said. The Fund was launched in 2014 and raised about $20.54 billion for its first fund.

288.title: BJP MPs stage protest against Bengal CM over SSC scam
288.article_body: West Bengal BJP MPs staged a protest outside the Parliament against Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee over the alleged involvement of sacked TMC minister Partha Chatterjee in the SSC scam. They were seen holding placards and raising slogans demanding arrests of those involved in the scam. Partha and his close associate Arpita Mukherjee are currently in the Enforcement Directorate's custody.

289.title: 22-year-old man stabbed to death in northeast Delhi's Khajuri Khas
289.article_body: A man was stabbed to death allegedly by a group of men in northeast Delhi's Khajuri Khas. The deceased, Anawarul Haq (22), hailed from Bihar and worked in a Biharipur-based factory which made school bags, police said. The CCTV footage showed some men, who are currently absconding, attacking the victim with knives and fleeing the spot, police added.

290.title: Fake call centre cheating US residents busted in Delhi, 1 arrested
290.article_body: The Delhi Police crime branch has busted a fake call centre, which allegedly cheated American residents by making them believe their computers were affected by a virus or hacked and arrested one person. The accused confessed that the call centre asked for $50-500 to fix the problem with the victims' computers. Incriminating evidence was found at the centre, police said.

291.title: Mani Ratnam completed Ponniyin Selvan 1 & 2 in 120 days: Karthi
291.article_body: Actor Karthi revealed filmmaker Mani Ratnam completed 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' and 'Ponniyin Selvan 2' in 120 days. "It's not easy to make two films in 120 days. We'd put on our makeup at 2-2.30 am. There'd be 30 people waiting ready to put makeup for us," he added. Karthi said they used to take the first shot at 6:30 am.

292.title: WhatsApp testing feature to allow group admins to delete messages: Report
292.article_body: Meta-owned WhatsApp is testing a new feature that allows group admins to delete messages for every member in the group chat, according to a report by WABetaInfo. This feature comes as a part of the beta release of the app on Google Play Store with version number 2.22.17.12. WhatsApp was reportedly testing waveforms for voice notes recently.

293.title: People of Gujarat will get spurious liquor if they vote for BJP: Kejriwal
293.article_body: AAP national convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that spurious liquor is being sold openly in Gujarat. "At present, people of Gujarat have two options, either they'll get spurious liquor if they vote for them (BJP) or they'll get employment if they vote for us," he added. "Electricity, school, jobs will be the issues now," Kejriwal stated.

294.title: Suspension of 4 Congress MPs withdrawn in Lok Sabha
294.article_body: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla revoked the suspension of Congress MPs, Manickam Tagore, Ramya Haridas, Jothimani and TN Prathapan, on Monday. The four party MPs were suspended on July 25 for the entire session by the speaker for carrying placards inside the House as a mark of protest. Congress leader Shashi Tharoor had earlier demanded the suspension to be revoked.

295.title: ₹3 cr illegal transaction done using a teacher's PAN number; FIR filed in Mumbai
295.article_body: A case of cheating was registered in Mumbai's Shivaji Nagar Police Station against an unidentified person for allegedly using the PAN number of a teacher for operating a GSTIN account and conducting transactions worth over ₹3 crore, police said. The matter came to light when the victim, Anil Jare, approached a CA to file his income tax return recently.

296.title: India create history, confirm their 1st ever medal in lawn bowls at CWG
296.article_body: India on Monday created history by confirming their first-ever medal in lawn bowls at CWG. India reached the gold medal match of the women's fours lawn bowls event at CWG 2022. India defeated New Zealand 16-13 in semi-final. India were represented by Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey in the semi-final. The final will take place tomorrow.

297.title: He knows exactly what is required: Bhuvneshwar on Arshdeep Singh
297.article_body: Praising Arshdeep Singh, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said his teammate's best thing is that he knows exactly what is required. "What kind of field setting is needed, how to bowl to each batsman- very few newcomers display that kind of maturity," he added. Arshdeep claimed 2/18 on his T20I debut against England and 2/24 in Friday's win against West Indies.

298.title: Woman who robbed husband 3 days after wedding arrested in MP
298.article_body: Police have arrested a woman along with her two accomplices who robbed her husband of ₹2 lakh just three days after their wedding. The incident occurred in May in Madhya Pradesh's Pithampur. Police had formed a special team to catch the three accused. The money has been recovered and the accused are being questioned.

299.title: 3 dead as car skids off road, falls into stream in Kerala amid rain
299.article_body: Three members of a family died when their car skidded off the road and fell into a nearby stream swollen with rainwater while trying to overtake a bus in Kerala's Pathanamthitta district. The passengers drowned in the stream by the time locals could rescue them, police said. An orange alert has been issued in seven districts of the state.

300.title: Nobody knew he took part, WB minister seems ignorant: Brother of CWG winner Sheuli
300.article_body: The brother of Commonwealth Games 2022 gold-winning weightlifter Achinta Sheuli said that nobody knew the 20-year-old from West Bengal participated in the Birmingham games. "Even the state's Sports Minister seems ignorant," said Alok, adding, "We need government support." Achinta, who created a Games record of 313 kg, credited his brother for the win.

301.title: Ajay Devgn has a crazy gut instinct as an artiste: 'Bholaa' writer Aamil
301.article_body: Speaking about the scripting process of 'Bholaa' with actor Ajay Devgn, co-writer Aamil Keeyan Khan has said, "Ajay has a crazy gut instinct as an artiste." Aamil added, "He knows exactly what to tweak, add and subtract to elevate a scene." The 'Runway 34' writer further said that Ajay is the happiest when he is wearing the director's hat.

302.title: Policeman beaten up for stopping tractor with illegally mined sand in Rajasthan
302.article_body: A police constable who stopped a tractor trolley with illegally mined sand was beaten up with sticks and iron rods by the driver's associates in Rajasthan's Kota on Sunday, police said. Constable Ram Chandra received multiple injuries and was shifted to a government hospital in Jhalawar. After thrashing the constable, the accused ran away with the tractor.

303.title: In previous years, England would've played more shots earlier: Morgan
303.article_body: Ex-England captain Eoin Morgan said the Jos-Buttler-led side, who lost the South Africa T20Is at home, lacked "aggressive batting" in the final two games of the three-match series. "In previous years, England would've played a lot more shots earlier as opposed to giving it more thought, more calculation," stated Morgan. England also lost the white-ball series to India in July.

304.title: ED being misused, extraordinary selective targeting of Oppn: Tharoor
304.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday said that the government institutions are not there to serve political purposes, the Times Now reported. "The ED is being misused…You have got an extraordinary selective targeting of Opposition people and I find this unacceptable because we are a country where democracy is a value in itself and it should be preserved," he added.

305.title: Accident causes traffic congestion at NH-48, Gurugram Police share details
305.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police on Monday took to Twitter to inform commuters about traffic congestion, caused by an accident, on National Highway 48 (NH-48). "Traffic congestion has been reported on NH-48 near Rajiv chowk towards Delhi due to vehicle accident. Our traffic officials present on the spot to facilitate the traffic.@gurgaonpolice," read the tweet by Gurugram Traffic Police.

306.title: Will start shooting for 'Singham 3' in April 2023: Director Rohit Shetty
306.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty in an interview said that he'll start shooting for 'Singham 3' with actor Ajay Devgn in April 2023. "We have already started working on Singham 3...It is going to be the biggest cop universe ever that we have made till date," he added. Rohit had earlier said that 'Singham 3' will be bigger than Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Sooryavanshi'.

307.title: Video claiming a Bengaluru pothole is 10 years old goes viral
307.article_body: A video claiming that a pothole near Bengaluru's Kanakapura main road is 10 years old has gone viral on social media. The video was shared by a Twitter handle by the name of 'I CHANGE Hemmigepura'. A user replied to the tweet saying, "Proposing a birthday party for the pothole." Another user wrote, "Should declare the place as heritage monument."

308.title: India's 1st monkeypox death confirmed, victim was 22-year-old Kerala man who visited UAE
308.article_body: Kerala health department has confirmed that the 22-year-old man who died on Saturday had succumbed to monkeypox. The confirmation came from the National Institute of Virology in Pune, making it India's first confirmed monkeypox death. Earlier, Kerala Health Minister Veena George said that the man had tested positive for monkeypox in the UAE before he reached Kerala on July 22.

309.title: Wanted to jump in a hole: Meg Lanning on missing hat-trick catch at CWG
309.article_body: Australia Women captain Meg Lanning dropped Barbados' Keila Elliott's catch off Australia spinner Alana King's hat-trick delivery during their match at the CWG 2022. On being asked about it, Lanning said, "I'll have nightmares, I wanted to dig a hole and jump in it as quick as I could." Australia defeated Barbados by nine wickets in the game.

310.title: West Bengal to get 7 new districts, total number to increase to 30
310.article_body: The West Bengal Cabinet has approved a proposal to carve out seven new districts, Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said on Monday. The new districts will be Berhampore, Kandi, Sunderbans, Bashirhat, Ichamati, Ranaghat and Bishnupur. A senior state government official said that the decision was taken to ensure smooth administrative operations. At present, the state has a total of 23 districts.

311.title: Uddhav visits arrested MP Sanjay Raut's house to meet his family
311.article_body: Shiv Sena chief and former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray reached arrested MP Sanjay Raut's residence on Monday to meet the former's family. Raut, who was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case on Monday early morning, was slated to be produced before a special PMLA court in Mumbai later in the day.

312.title: I feel more comfortable doing massy entertainers: Varun Dhawan
312.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said that he feels "more comfortable" doing mass entertainers. "Every time I walk into a set to play a character which is very different from what I have played before, it gives me jitters," he added. Varun stated, "Even if you're doing a massy entertainer, you need to figure out newer ways of entertaining the audience."

313.title: New Bengaluru-Mysuru highway to be ready for use in Oct: Centre
313.article_body: The first phase of renovation of the Bengaluru-Mysuru national highway, which covers a 61 km-stretch between Mysuru and Nidaghatta, will be completed in September, Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said. Meanwhile, the 56.2 km--long Nidaghatta-Bengaluru stretch is likely to be opened by October 20. The highway's six main carriageways will be ready for public use by October-end, he added.

314.title: Pune woman looks for SBI number online, finds fake contact; loses ₹2,22,000
314.article_body: A Pune woman was cheated of ₹2,22,000 after she searched for the contact of State Bank of India (SBI) and found a fake one. She browsed the internet and called an SBI customer care number. The fraudster asked her to download two mobile applications on her phone and then hacked her phone and transferred ₹2,22,000 from her account.

315.title: Heroin worth ₹8 crore seized in Assam, 2 arrested for drug peddling
315.article_body: Assam Police has arrested two persons on the charge of drug peddling after seizing heroin with an international value of ₹8 crore on Sunday, officials said. A joint team of the police and CRPF intercepted a vehicle following a tip-off and recovered around 75 boxes containing 966 grams of heroin. The accused were transporting the heroin from Dimapur to Guwahati.

316.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash reveals daughter's face, names her Arna
316.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash took to Instagram on Monday to share a post revealing the face of her daughter for the first time. "Introducing Arna," she wrote alongside the picture. Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "Super cute. God bless little angel," while another commented, "Cuteness overloaded." Pranitha and her husband Nithin Raju welcomed Arna in June.

317.title: Rajasthan man beaten up by relatives, hands tied on suspicion of affair with widow
317.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly beaten up by his relatives in Rajasthan’s Jhalawar on Saturday on suspicion of having an affair with a widow in the family, police said. The man was purportedly made to walk with his hands tied, the police added. Station House Officer (SHO), Guman Singh, said that the accused "wanted to teach him a lesson".

318.title: 4th Nigerian national arrested in 10 days in Pune for drug trafficking
318.article_body: Another Nigerian national, Okeke Infechukwu John (29), was arrested by the Pune Police for allegedly carrying out drug trafficking. John is the fourth Nigerian citizen to be arrested in the last 10 days in Pune for drug-related charges. Around 18 grams of cocaine worth over Rs 2.7 lakh and two bikes were seized from John, police said.

319.title: Dubai-bound man held with foreign currency worth ₹60 lakh at Delhi airport
319.article_body: A man has been arrested from Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport with foreign currency worth ₹60 lakh including 2,62,500 Saudi Riyal and 5,000 US dollars. He was travelling to Dubai. Officials stated that the currency was concealed inside the side false layer of his handbag to avoid detection. Upon questioning, the man failed to produce valid documents for the currency.

320.title: Video of 8-year-old twin sisters confusing Viswanathan Anand with a question goes viral
320.article_body: A video of eight-year-old twin sisters confusing ex-world chess champion Viswanathan Anand with a question during Chess Olympiad went viral. Sharing it, Anand wrote, "Question of the day." In the video, one of the twin sisters seemingly asked, "How to reset the pieces?" and while Anand started answering, she interrupted, saying, "No...How to distract...pieces?" Anand replied, "I've no idea."

321.title: Price hike is normal: Kartik on rumours of increasing fee by ₹40cr
321.article_body: Reacting to rumours of increasing his fee by ₹40 crore, Kartik Aaryan neither confirmed nor denied it. He said a price hike is normal if a film is able to earn a certain amount because of the combined success rate of everyone involved. "You need to find a balance...You don't want the hike to seem to be unreal," Kartik added.

322.title: BESCOM engineer caught taking bribe of ₹1.3 lakh in Bengaluru
322.article_body: An assistant engineer of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) was caught taking a bribe of ₹1.3 lakh by Anti Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials on Monday. The engineer reportedly demanded ₹3 lakh to provide electricity connection to an apartment in Marappa Garden near Benson Town. ACB officials claim that an electrical contractor from RT Nagar requested for the line approval.

323.title: Pat Cummins marries his longtime British girlfriend, shares pic
323.article_body: Australia Test captain Pat Cummins tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Becky Boston, who is a British-born interior designer. Sharing a picture on Instagram, he wrote, "Just married." The couple got engaged in February 2020 and they were blessed with their first child last year.  Several cricketers, including David Warner, congratulated the couple.

324.title: Mahindra & Mahindra shares hit all-time high after Scorpio-N bookings soar
324.article_body: Shares of Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) hit an all-time high of ₹1,247 apiece on Monday. On Saturday, the company recorded 1,00,000 bookings for the all-new Scorpio-N within 30 minutes of the booking commencement, with over 25,000 bookings within one minute. Notably, this was the fifth consecutive session when the stock traded higher.

325.title: 26-yr-old peddler arrested in Pune; mephedrone drug worth ₹1.07 crore seized
325.article_body: Pune Police arrested a 26-year-old peddler and seized mephedrone drug worth ₹1.07 crore in the city's Vimannagar area. The accused, Ravindra Arvind Birhade, was caught in a police-laid trap and then, booked under sections 8(c), 21(c) and 29 of the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act, police said. Notably, the police acted on a tip-off to catch Birhade.

326.title: 10 dead due to flooding amid heavy rains in Uganda: Red Cross
326.article_body: At least 10 people have died after heavy rains caused flooding that burst river banks in eastern Uganda, the Red Cross said on Sunday. The deceased are from the neighbouring districts of Kapchorwa and Mbale. "This disaster is due to environmental degradation...How many people are going to die like this?" the country's PM Robinah Nabbanja told reporters.

327.title: NZ fully reopens borders for 1st time since COVID-19 pandemic began
327.article_body: New Zealand on Monday fully reopened its borders to visitors for the first time since coronavirus pandemic began in March 2020. It'll now allow visitors who need visas and those on student visas to return. Cruise ships and foreign recreational yachts will also be allowed to dock at the country's ports. Most visitors will still need to be fully vaccinated.

328.title: Thanks Modi ji, do we pay GST on this too: Srinivas on Bihar minister's video
328.article_body: While tweeting the video of Bihar minister Ram Surat Rai telling people that they're all alive because of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Indian Youth Congress National President Srinivas BV said, "Thank you Modi ji, do we pay GST on this too?" Rai was speaking to the crowd about the COVID-19 pandemic.

329.title: 38 students ill after worms, insects found in Telangana school's food
329.article_body: Around 38 students fell ill, four had to be hospitalised and four others were kept in observation after consuming a meal provided at a tribal welfare gurukul school in Telangana's Mahabubabad. Students have stated that they complained after finding earthworms and insects in the food but the authorities did not pay heed. The hostel houses around 953 students.

330.title: 3 of family killed after train engine hits car at railway crossing in Assam
330.article_body: A car was hit by a train engine at the Puranigudam railway crossing in Assam's Nagaon district on Sunday night, which led to the death of three members of a family. All three died on the spot and have been identified as Chandra Kalita, Nilima Devi and Sunny Kalita, police said. Notably, the train was coming from Silghat.

331.title: 22-year-old Kanwariya dies after car hits bike in UP's Etah
331.article_body: A 22-year-old Kanwariya died and two others got injured after a car hit their motorbike in Etah, Uttar Pradesh. The incident took place at 3:30 am on Monday, police said. Notably, the car occupants were en route to Soron to immerse the ashes of a relative in the Ganges river, police added. The deceased was identified as Vinay.

332.title: It's something I'll never forget: Alia on 'Heart of Stone' shoot
332.article_body: Alia Bhatt, sharing her experience of working on her Hollywood debut 'Heart of Stone', said it's something that she'll never forget because of how beautifully she was treated over there. "I'd quite a task at hand...because I was shooting for...first time an action movie...I'm also pregnant...so there were so many layers...to deal with...But they made it so easy," she added.

333.title: West Bengal's cabinet reshuffle on Aug 3, CM says there will be 4-5 new faces
333.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Monday announced that cabinet reshuffle in the state will take place on Wednesday (August 3) and added that there will be four-five new faces in cabinet. "We lost Ministers Subrata Mukherjee, Sadhan Pande. Partha is in jail so all their work has to be done. Not possible for me to handle alone," Mamata said.

334.title: Not appropriate to run proceedings this way: Om Birla as LS adjourned amid protest
334.article_body: The Lok Sabha was adjourned on Monday following a protest by the Opposition MPs. “I want to maintain the dignity of the House. It’s not appropriate to run the proceedings this way,” Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said as the lower house was adjourned till 12 pm today. Later, the Lok Sabha was again adjourned till 2 pm today.

335.title: Alibaba looks to maintain NY listing after addition to US delisting watchlist
335.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holdings Ltd said it would work to maintain listings on New York Stock Exchange and Hong Kong. On Friday, US Securities and Exchange Commission added Alibaba to a list of 270 other Chinese firms that might be delisted for failing to comply with American auditing standards. US regulators demand full access to audit working papers.

336.title: 6-yr-old girl writes letter to PM Modi on rising cost of pencil, maggi; pic goes viral
336.article_body: A six-year-old girl's letter to PM Narendra Modi about the rising prices of pencil, eraser, and maggi has gone viral on social media. "Modi ji, you have caused an immense price rise...Now my mother beats me for asking for a pencil. What shall I do? Other kids steal my pencil," the girl from Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj wrote in the letter.

337.title: Forced to work as sex slave in prison, says former Israeli guard; PM orders probe
337.article_body: A former guard at a maximum security prison in Israel has alleged she was repeatedly raped by a Palestinian inmate after being forced to work as a "sex slave" by her superiors. Israeli PM Yair Lapid promised an investigation, saying, "It cannot be (tolerated) that a soldier is raped by a terrorist during her service."

338.title: Man forced to tie mother's body to bike, ride 80km after MP hospital denies hearse van
338.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol was forced to tie his dead mother's body to a motorcycle and ride it back to his village 80 km away allegedly after district hospital didn't provide a hearse van. The man reportedly couldn't afford private vehicles that asked for ₹5,000. The woman's sons alleged she died due to lack of proper treatment.

339.title: Opposition's voice being stifled using govt machinery: Shiv Sena MP
339.article_body: The people of the country are watching how voice of the Opposition is being stifled using the government machinery, Shiv Sena MP Anil Desai said on Monday. His statement came after party MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by the ED on Sunday night, after hours of questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

340.title: Kerala CM cautions people amid heavy rain warning
340.article_body: Kerala CM P Vijayan has warned the public to exercise caution amid forecast of heavy rainfall. Government agencies have been instructed to be on alert and people living in low-lying areas have been advised to evacuate. “As the India Meteorological Department has warned of heavy rains in the state for next five days, people should be very vigilant,” said Vijayan.

341.title: Taliban denies 'drone attack' in Kabul, says rocket hit empty house
341.article_body: A spokesperson from the Taliban's Interior Ministry on Sunday denied reports of a drone attack in Afghanistan's Kabul and said that a rocket had hit an empty house, reported TOLO news. Earlier, Afghanistan's former National Directorate of Security (NDS) head Rahmatullah Nabil had tweeted, "As per ground sources...American drones were seen in (Kabul's) airspace...and struck different locations."

342.title: Woman who started as a sweeper, becomes AGM at SBI in Mumbai 37 years later
342.article_body: A woman, aged 20, who started working as a part-time sweeper at an SBI branch in Mumbai after her husband's demise, has risen to become the bank's Assistant General Manager 37 years later. Pratiksha Tondwalkar got married at the age of 16, before completing her Class 10 exams. She cleared her subsequent studies after joining the bank as a sweeper.

343.title: Not in favour of Pant opening, he's India’s pivotal player: Reetinder Sodhi
343.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said he doesn't want Rishabh Pant to open for India in T20Is as the wicketkeeper-batter is the team's pivotal player. "India need him when the game gets tight in the 15th-16th over. You can better utilise him in the middle overs," stated Sodhi. Pant opened in two T20Is in England and scored 26 and 1.

344.title: Lawyer who filed PILs against Jharkhand CM arrested in Kolkata
344.article_body: Lawyer Rajiv Kumar, who had filed PILs against Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren over corruption, was arrested by Kolkata Police on Sunday for allegedly cheating people of ₹50 lakh. Kumar was picked up from a bar under the Hare Street police station area following a warrant issued against him by Jharkhand Police. Stacks of money were reportedly found on him.

345.title: Which states have received less than normal rainfall so far?
345.article_body: India Meteorological Department data showed that till July 31, UP had a rain deficiency of 46%, Jharkhand 49%, Bihar 39% and West Bengal 26%. There has also been 16% rain deficiency over eastern and northeastern India. IMD DGM Mrutyunjay Mohapatra said there were above normal rains over central and peninsular India, but high deficiency over states in the Gangetic plains.

346.title: 325+ K'taka buses booked for Siddaramaiah's b'day, hundreds more to be booked
346.article_body: More than 325 buses of the Northwest Karnataka Road Transport Corporation have been booked for the celebration of 75th birth anniversary programme of Congress leader Siddaramaiah in Davanagere. Reports said that hundreds of more buses are expected to be booked. Reports added that preparations to invite and take 5000-6000 workers from each assembly constituency of the district.

347.title: Arjun, Tara hold housefull board for 'Ek Villain Returns' at Gaiety Cinema
347.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a picture on Sunday of holding a housefull sign outside Mumbai's Gaiety Cinema for his film 'Ek Villain Returns'. Arjun was joined by his co-stars Tara Sutaria and Disha Patani. He wrote alongside the picture, "Housefull board outside a cinema that's all we work for." The film has earned $1 million at the global box office.

348.title: Kichcha Sudeepa's 'Vikrant Rona' crosses ₹100cr worldwide after 1st weekend
348.article_body: Kichcha Sudeepa-starrer 'Vikrant Rona' is estimated to have collected over ₹110 crore worldwide within four days of its release. As per estimates from the industry, it earned approximately ₹29 crore on Sunday.  The film was released in five languages including Kannada, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Hindi. It is directed by Anup Bhandari and also features Nirup Bhandari and Neetha Ashok.

349.title: Loud music at night to end soon: Hyderabad Police Commissioner
349.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand said that authorities will soon put an end to loud music being played at night. His statement comes after loud music was played near his residence in wee hours of Sunday. The commissioner said that he called 100 and did not reveal his identity while making the complaint and was happy with police's quick response.

350.title: Pat Carroll, voice behind Disney villain Ursula in Little Mermaid, dies at 95
350.article_body: American actress and comedian Pat Carroll, voice behind Disney villain Ursula in 'The Little Mermaid', has passed away at the age of 95. Carroll died on Saturday of pneumonia at her home in Massachusetts, her daughter Kerry Karsian told The Hollywood Reporter. Carroll won an Emmy for her work on the sketch comedy series 'Caesar's Hour' in 1956.

351.title: Raut held for non-cooperation, unaccounted cash & incriminating documents: ED
351.article_body: As per Hindustan Times, the Enforcement Directorate officials said that Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut was arrested due to "non-cooperation", "unaccounted cash recovered at his residence", and recovery of "incriminating documents" from his place.
