ED had detained Raut after conducting a search for over nine hours at Raut's Bhandup residence on Sunday.

352.title: Sanjay Arora takes charge as Delhi Police Commissioner
352.article_body: Sanjay Arora, a senior IPS officer of Tamil Nadu cadre, took charge as the Commissioner of Delhi Police today (August 1). The 57-year-old officer was accorded the ceremonial guard of honour by the police force upon his arrival at the Delhi Police Headquarters. He will succeed Rakesh Asthana who retired on Sunday (July 31) after nearly 38 years in service.

353.title: 16-year-old student confirmed as 1st monkeypox case in Sudan
353.article_body: Sudan's Health Ministry said in a statement on Sunday that the country has recorded its first monkeypox case. The statement added that a 16-year-old student was confirmed to be infected with the disease on Thursday in West Darfur state. A senior official from the ministry said that the other 38 suspected cases of the disease have all tested negative.

354.title: Beirut grain silo damaged in 2020 blast collapses after weeks-long fire
354.article_body: A section of grain silo at Beirut port collapsed on Sunday, after weeks-long fire triggered by summer heat fermented grains. Last week, Lebanese officials had warned that a part of the silo could collapse after it started tilting. The incident reminded the capital city of the horrors of the 2020 explosion that left 215 people dead, Reuters reported.

355.title: Truly a proud moment as Achinta from WB wins CWG gold: Mamata Banerjee
355.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee took to Twitter to congratulate 20-year-old weightlifter Achinta Sheuli for winning the gold medal in the men's 73-kg category at the CWG 2022. "Truly a proud moment for all of us as young Achinta from West Bengal wins gold...Your success will serve as an inspiration to countless others in the country," tweeted CM Banerjee.

356.title: Bihar minister tells crowd 'You're alive because of PM Modi', video viral
356.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, Bihar minister Ram Surat Rai, a BJP leader, can be seen telling a crowd, "If you all...are alive today...it is because of...[PM] Narendra Modi." He said so while talking about COVID-19 pandemic. "We were saved by...Modi's vaccine and his deft handling of economy," he can be seen saying in video.

357.title: Telangana government to distribute 1 crore national flags
357.article_body: The Telangana government will celebrate 'Swatantra Bharatha Vajrotsavalu' for two weeks from August 8 in wake of the nation's 75th Independence Day. It will distribute 1 crore national flags for hoisting across the state. Films on unity and patriotism will also be shown free of cost to school children in all the cinema halls.

358.title: Before Satya's release, SRK joked 'remove JD & put me in film': JD
358.article_body: Actor JD Chakravarthy recalled how he got a phone call from Shah Rukh Khan the evening before Satya's release. "He said, 'If 'Satya' is to become...disaster, what do you think we should do?' I got offended and said, 'You tell me what we should do'," JD said, adding, "Shah Rukh said, 'Replace JD...with Shah Rukh.' I understood he was joking."

359.title: People feel I don't like India: Aamir Khan on 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' Twitter trend
359.article_body: Reacting to 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' trend on Twitter, Aamir Khan said, "I feel sad that some of the people who are saying this, in their heart, they believe that I am someone who doesn't like India....but it is untrue." Calling it unfortunate that people feel that way, he urged, "Please don't boycott my film."

360.title: Why is China's real estate sector currently facing a crisis?
360.article_body: China's real estate sector is currently facing a crisis as buyers across the country have stopped paying mortgages for homes sold before completion. The boycott comes after the sector was hit by a funding crisis, leading to defaults and stalled projects. Meanwhile, S&P Global Ratings estimated that Chinese banks could face $356 billion in losses due to the ongoing crisis.

361.title: That's gonna be crazy one: Naga on if he will do a film with Samantha
361.article_body: During an interview, actor Naga Chaitanya was asked if he and his ex-wife Samantha Prabhu will ever share screen space in a film. To this, the actor replied, "That's gonna be a crazy one if it happens. But I don't know, only the universe knows. Let's see." Naga and Samantha announced their split on Instagram in October 2021.

362.title: Shreyas is ahead of Hooda in pecking order: Saba Karim on no.3 spot in T20Is
362.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Saba Karim has said Shreyas Iyer is ahead of Deepak Hooda in the pecking order for the number three position in India's T20I playing XI. "That being the case, he will have to be given a few more chances in the upcoming games," added Karim. Shreyas got out for a duck in the first T20I against West Indies.

363.title: 4 arrested in Bengaluru for blackmailing widows, divorcees over nude videos
363.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested four members of a gang for allegedly assaulting, blackmailing and extorting widows and divorced women over nude videos. The accused, including a woman, targeted the victims under the pretext of helping them out with financial assistance and jobs, the police said. They later kidnapped the victim and would threaten them to strip and made nude videos.

364.title: India's manufacturing PMI surges to 8-month high of 56.4 in July
364.article_body: India's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI), compiled by S&P Global, surged to an eight-month high amid growth in new orders and output. The PMI rose to 56.4 in July as compared to 53.9 in June and 54.6 in May. The July PMI data indicated an improvement in overall operating conditions for the 13th straight month.

365.title: Issue of 'Operation Keechad’ in J’khand to be raised in Parliament: Kharge
365.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said that the Opposition will raise the issues of inflation and the Gujarat hooch tragedy in the Parliament. "'Operation Keechad' by them (BJP) in Jharkhand will also be raised today," Kharge added. His statement came after three Jharkhand MLAs were caught with huge amount of cash on Saturday. They were suspended from Congress.

366.title: Firefighters battle blaze near Lisbon amid strong winds
366.article_body: More than 400 firefighters, backed by water-bombers and 123 vehicles, battled a blaze burning near Lisbon, the capital city of Portugal. Soaring temperatures and strong winds made it more difficult to put out the fire, forcing authorities to block several roads, reports said. Portugal has been facing a heatwave, like other parts of Europe, with temperatures reaching 40 degree Celsius.

367.title: GST collection hits nearly ₹1.49 lakh crore in July, second-highest ever
367.article_body: The government on Monday said that ₹1,48,995 crore gross GST revenue was collected in July 2022, marking the second highest amount of revenue collected since the introduction of GST. The revenues for July are 28% higher than the GST revenues in the same month last year. The highest GST collection ever recorded was in April 2022 at ₹1.68 lakh crore.

368.title: Why is ED silent on Jharkhand Congress MLAs cash case?: TMC
368.article_body: The Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress questioned Enforcement Directorate's (ED) "silence" on the recovery of unaccounted cash worth lakhs from the vehicle of Congress MLAs from Jharkhand. TMC also demanded a probe into the role of West Bengal's Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari over his recent remark that "after Maharashtra, it will be Jharkhand, Rajasthan and West Bengal."

369.title: US House Speaker Pelosi begins tour of 4 Asian nations
369.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi began an Asian tour during which she is scheduled to visit Singapore, Malaysia, South Korea and Japan. "The trip will focus on mutual security, economic partnership and democratic governance in the Indo-Pacific region," an official statement said. There have been speculation but no confirmation over whether Pelosi will visit the self-ruled island nation Taiwan.

370.title: Japan calls for release of Japanese man detained in Myanmar
370.article_body: Japan has called for the release of a Japanese man who has been detained in Myanmar. According to Deputy Chief Cabinet Secretary, the detained Japanese national is in his 20s and was filming a documentary. Local media reports said that the man was participating in an anti-coup protest held in Yangon and was detained for questioning at a police station.

371.title: Father-son sentenced to 20 yrs for abduction, rape of minor girl in Raj
371.article_body: A POCSO court in Rajasthan's Kota sentenced a man and his father to 20 years for the abduction and rape of a minor girl. The convict is a cousin of the victim who was 13 at the time of the crime. Court imposed ₹30,000 fine on him and ₹20,000 on his father for rendering protection and help in the crime.

372.title: 24-yr-old man undergoes hands transplant in TN, hands flown in from Gujarat
372.article_body: A 24-year-old man from Tamil Nadu successfully underwent a bilateral hand transplant surgery involving a marathon procedure, the hospital treating him said on Sunday. The man had lost both his hands suffering burns from electrocution in 2018 and his mother was taking care of him, the hospital release said. The donor hands were flown to Chennai from Gujarat after clearances.

373.title: Haven't been home at all in last 2 years: India's 19-yr-old Jeremy after winning CWG gold
373.article_body: After bagging gold at CWG 2022, 19-year-old Indian weightlifter Jeremy Lalrinnunga, who hails from Mizoram's Aizawl, stated he hasn't been home at all in the last two years. "I'm thinking of taking leave for seven days to go home and spend time with family," he said. Jeremy lifted a total of 300 kg in men's 67-kg category to bag gold.

374.title: Video of biryani pots drifting away in Hyderabad rains goes viral; Twitter users react
374.article_body: A video showing two biryani vessels floating away in a waterlogged street in Hyderabad has gone viral on Twitter. The video was shot outside 'Adiba Hotel' in Hyderabad's Nawab Saheb Kunta. "Somebody is going to be unhappy for not getting his biryani order," wrote a Twitter user. Another user wrote, "Dum biryani ki aisi ki taisi...new hit is Tairti Biryani."

375.title: Why Gujarat youth is being pushed towards drug addiction?: Rahul
375.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has criticised the BJP for allegedly protecting the drugs and liquor mafias in Gujarat. "How come drugs are constantly shipped to Mundra port despite it being recovered from there thrice...Whether law and order don't exist in Gujarat?" Rahul tweeted. He asked, "Why the youth of Gujarat is being pushed towards drug addiction?"

376.title: Delhi govt to allow private liquor shops to operate for one more month
376.article_body: Delhi government will be releasing permit for private liquor shops to run for one more month in  national capital. Reports quoted a source saying that government shops might take another month to start, which is why private ones are being allowed to run for extended period. Private liquor shops had to shut on July 31 following expiration of their licenses.

377.title: Favreau said 'You can't kill Iron Man, it'll devastate people': Joe Russo
377.article_body: Filmmaker Joe Russo, who was the co-director of 'Avengers: Endgame', revealed that Jon Favreau asked them not to kill Iron Man in the film. "Favreau was like, 'You can't do this. It's gonna devastate people and you don't want them...walking out of the theatre and into traffic'," Joe added. "We did it anyway," he further stated.

378.title: Pic shows french fries & sausage being sold for ₹1,000 at CWG; Twitter users criticise
378.article_body: A fan purchased frozen french fries and sausage at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham for £9.80 (nearly ₹1,000) and took to Twitter to share a photo of it. Reacting to his photo, a Twitter user commented, "The chips look like they were cooked in a kettle." Another remarked, "Do you have to pay more to get the chips cooked."

379.title: England beat Germany in extra time to win their first-ever Women's Euro
379.article_body: England defeated eight-time champions Germany in extra time to win their first-ever Women's European Championship. England's Chloe Kelly scored in the extra time with the game levelled at 1-1 after 90 minutes. "It's the proudest moment of my life so I'm going to lap it up and take every single second in," said England captain Leah Williamson.

380.title: UN peacekeepers open fire at border post in Congo, kill 2 people
380.article_body: UN peacekeepers who were returning from leave opened fire at a border post in Democratic Republic of Congo's (DRC) Kasindi, killing at least two people and injuring 15 others, UN and Congo officials said on Sunday. The peacekeepers were military personnel of UN mission in the country. The perpetrators were arrested, the head of the UN mission in DRC said.

381.title: Son clears army training from same academy 27 years after his mother; govt shares pics
381.article_body: Defence Ministry's Public Relations Officer of Chennai shared a picture of retired Major Smita Chaturvedi posing with her son after he cleared his army training. "A rare euphoric moment for a Lady Officer: Major Smita Chaturvedi (Retd) Commissioned from Officers Training Academy, Chennai...in 1995, saw her son getting Commissioned in the same manner in the same Academy," the post read.

382.title: Divine punishment: BJP's Ram Kadam after ED arrests Sanjay Raut
382.article_body: BJP leader Ram Kadam, without naming Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut after the ED arrested him, on Monday said it is a "divine punishment". "That's why they say, it isn't good to play with fire...This is a divine punishment...These are newly changed India's laws and empowered power of democracy," Kadam tweeted. Raut was arrested by the ED on Sunday night.

383.title: Shiv Sena plans to launch protests against Raut's arrest by ED
383.article_body: Shiv Sena is planning to launch protests against Sanjay Raut's arrest by ED, Raut's brother Sunil Raut stated. Shiv Sena is firmly behind the Raut family and will stand with it till Sanjay Raut is released from custody, he added. He was arrested after hours of questioning in relation with alleged money laundering linked to redevelopment of a Mumbai chawl.

384.title: Dharmendra wraps up Johar's 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'
384.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra has wrapped his shoot on Karan Johar's directorial 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. The actor was joined by son Bobby Deol and grandson Aryaman Deol on the last day of his shoot. In the upcoming movie, Dharmendra will share screen space with Ranveer Singh, Alia Bhatt, Shabana Azmi, Jaya Bachchan and others.

385.title: We told Pak terrorism is high cost option after Pulwama: Tamil Nadu Guv
385.article_body: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has stated that India's response to the Pulwama terror attack showed Pakistan that terrorism is a high-cost option. "What happened after Pulwama? We hit them back. 250 km inside using airpower. With precision," he said. Ravi further stated that anyone who uses a gun should be dealt with a gun with zero tolerance for violence.

386.title: Man suffering from mental illness jumps to death from Mumbai hotel
386.article_body: A 59-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after he jumped from the ninth floor of a five-star hotel in Lower Parel, Mumbai. The deceased, Sorab Khandalawala, was undergoing treatment for mental illness since 2005 at Masina hospital in Byculla, police said. Notably, Khandalawala had come to the hotel for lunch on Sunday before allegedly killing himself at 1 pm.

387.title: We don't even have soil to put on wickets in Pak: Salman Butt on foreign mentors in PJL
387.article_body: Pakistan's former skipper Salman Butt took a dig at the PCB and its chairman Ramiz Raja for bringing mentors from abroad for Pakistan Junior League (PJL). Butt said, "There are no players who can mentor youngsters in Pakistan. We don't even have soil to put on wickets in Pakistan." He added, "Bring a chairman from some other country too, no?"

388.title: Was a pre-emptive strike: Singer Madonna on directing her own biopic
388.article_body: Singer Madonna opened up about directing her biopic and called it a "pre-emptive strike" as many people were trying to make a film about her. "A lot of people were trying to make movies about me. Mostly misogynistic men. So, I put my foot in the door and said, 'No one's going to tell my story but me'," she added.

389.title: Vijay Deverakonda's female fan faints amid overcrowding at Liger event in Navi Mumbai
389.article_body: A female fan fainted as massive crowd turned up at Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday starrer Liger's promotional event at a Navi Mumbai mall. A video shared by Viral Bhayani showed staff helping the woman. The actors were forced to leave the event midway, with Dharma Productions saying, "Unfortunately, we had to leave mid-way for the safety of everyone."

390.title: Was great to share screen space with Aamir Khan in 'Laal...': Naga
390.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya opened up about his experience of working with Aamir Khan in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "The experience was simply great. I decided to do 'Laal Singh Chaddha' even before I heard the script, as I wanted to be next to Aamir," he stated. Naga said Aamir taught him so much and added he's glad he got this opportunity.

391.title: Won't bow down: Shiv Sena MP on Sanjay Raut's arrest
391.article_body: After Enforcement Directorate (ED) arrested Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in an alleged money laundering case, MP Vinayak Raut has vowed to back his party leader. "We will not bow down to ED. Raut has full support of Maharashtra," said Vinayak. Sanjay Raut was arrested by ED on Sunday night after hours of questioning in the ₹1,034 crore scam.

392.title: DTCP seals 123 shops, demolishes 12 in Gurugram's DLF Phase-3
392.article_body: The enforcement team of Department of Town & Country Planning (DTCP) demolished 12 illegal shops and sealed 123 more on 43 plots in Block U of DLF Phase-3, Gurugram. The action was taken in presence of 150 police personnel. "Many property owners had put large plyboards to hide their shop signs on residential plots...This is illegal," a senior official said.

393.title: Video of 20-year-old Achinta lifting record 170 kg to win gold at CWG goes viral
393.article_body: A video of 20-year-old Indian weightlifter Achinta Sheuli lifting a record 170 kg in clean and jerk to win gold in men's 73-kg category went viral. Achinta failed to lift 170 kg in second attempt, however, he made a successful lift in third attempt. Achinta lifted a total of 313 kg, including 143 kg in snatch, to set CWG record.

394.title: I have no home to go to: SL President after protesters burn down his house
394.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Ranil Wickremesinghe said that people have threatened to stage protests if he doesn't go home. "I am appealing to you not to do that as I have no home to go to," Wickremesinghe, whose private residence was set on fire by protesters last month, said. Protesters must either rebuild the country or rebuild the house, he added.

395.title: 'Rang De Basanti' was exciting for me for 9 minutes: Madhavan
395.article_body: Speaking about his role in 2006 film 'Rang De Basanti', actor R Madhavan stated that the film was only valid and very exciting for him for nine minutes. The actor had nine minutes of screen presence in the film. He portrayed Flight Lt Ajay Singh Rathod who is killed when his MiG-21 jet malfunctions and crashes.

396.title: Confidence has taken bit of a dent: Buttler after T20I series defeat to SA
396.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said their confidence has taken a "bit of a dent" after they lost the three-match T20I series against South Africa 1-2. "I can be honest enough to say we haven't performed how we would've liked the whole summer," he stated. England suffered a 90-run defeat in the third T20I against South Africa on Sunday.

397.title: BMC's fire audit finds serious lapses in 441 nursing homes in Mumbai
397.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), which conducted a special drive of fire audit from July 11-25, has found 441 nursing homes across Mumbai to have not complied with the fire safety norms and registered an FIR against 10 such nursing homes. The civic body inspected 1,258 nursing homes, out of which 643 nursing homes have complied with fire safety measures.

398.title: Zomato to get multiple CEOs for its firms, will call organisation 'Eternal': CEO Goyal
398.article_body: In an internal communication to the staff, Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal said that the company will now have multiple CEOs for its entities- Zomato, Blinkit, Hyperpure and Feeding India. He added the larger organisation will be called 'Eternal', however, this will be an internal name for now. He added that all CEOs will act as peers to each other.

399.title: 105 people, including tourists, rescued after flash floods in Himachal
399.article_body: At least 105 people, including mostly tourists, were rescued after they were stranded due to flash floods in Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul and Spiti on Sunday. A parked vehicle was damaged after boulders fell on it. The tourists were rescued in a three-hour-long rescue mission around 1:30 am and all of them are safe and provided food and logistics, officials stated.

400.title: Hyd techie rescued from valley near Dhakoba fort near Pune after 11 hrs
400.article_body: A Hyderabad techie who came to Maharashtra's Murbad on Saturday for a trek near Pune, lost his way due to fog in the area. After he contacted Maharashtra Mountaineering Rescue Coordination Centre (MMRCC) for help, he was rescued after 11 hours. The rescue team had reached the area with necessary equipments and an ambulance.

401.title: Disruption in Parliament adversely impacts common man's life: RS Dy Chairman
401.article_body: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh Narayan Singh on Sunday said that a disruption in the Parliament has an adverse impact on the life of a common man. The Parliament can abdicate its responsibility only at its own peril, he added. Furthermore, he said that continued interruption in the Parliament can give way to lack of executive accountability and judicial overreach.

402.title: Harvest under threat to be twice less this year: Ukraine Prez
402.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted on Sunday that the country's harvest is under threat this year and will be "twice less" amid war with Russia. Earlier, Ukraine and Russia had signed separate but identical agreements with Turkey and UN to resume Ukrainian grain export. He said that Ukraine's main goal is to "prevent global food crisis caused by Russian invasion".

403.title: Myanmar junta to extend state of emergency for 6 months
403.article_body: The state of emergency in Myanmar will be extended for six more months. "We must continue to strengthen the genuine and disciplined multi-party democratic system," the head of Myanmar's junta, Min Aung Hlaing reportedly said. Myanmar military staged a coup in February 2021, overthrowing the democratically elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi, triggering nation-wide protests against the military rule.
